content: 1 Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:
content_old: 1 Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:

content: 2 For knowing wisdom and instruction, For understanding sayings of intelligence,
content_old: 2 For knowing wisdom and instruction, For understanding sayings of intelligence,

content: 3 For receiving the instruction of wisdom, Righteousness, judgment, and uprightness,
content_old: 3 For receiving the instruction of wisdom, Righteousness, judgment, and uprightness,

content: 4 For giving to simple ones—prudence, To a youth—knowledge and discretion.
content_old: 4 For giving to simple ones—prudence, To a youth—knowledge and discretion.

content: 5 (The wise doth hear and increaseth learning, And the intelligent doth obtain counsels.)
content_old: 5 (The wise doth hear and increaseth learning, And the intelligent doth obtain counsels.)

content: 6 For understanding a proverb and its sweetness, Words of the wise and their acute sayings.
content_old: 6 For understanding a proverb and its sweetness, Words of the wise and their acute sayings.

content: 7 Fear of Jehovah is a beginning of knowledge, Wisdom and instruction fools have despised!
content_old: 7 Fear of Jehovah is a beginning of knowledge, Wisdom and instruction fools have despised!

content: 8 Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father, And leave not the law of thy mother,
content_old: 8 Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father, And leave not the law of thy mother,

content: 9 For a graceful wreath are they to thy head, And chains to thy neck.
content_old: 9 For a graceful wreath are they to thy head, And chains to thy neck.

content: 10 My son, if sinners entice thee be not willing.
content_old: 10 My son, if sinners entice thee be not willing.

content: 11 If they say, ‘Come with us, we lay wait for blood, We watch secretly for the innocent without cause,
content_old: 11 If they say, ‘Come with us, we lay wait for blood, We watch secretly for the innocent without cause,

content: 12 We swallow them as Sheol—alive, And whole—as those going down to the pit,
content_old: 12 We swallow them as Sheol—alive, And whole—as those going down to the pit,

content: 13 Every precious substance we find, We fill our houses with spoil,
content_old: 13 Every precious substance we find, We fill our houses with spoil,

content: 14 Thy lot thou dost cast among us, One purse is—to all of us.’
content_old: 14 Thy lot thou dost cast among us, One purse is—to all of us.’

content: 15 My son! go not in the way with them, Withhold thy foot from their path,
content_old: 15 My son! go not in the way with them, Withhold thy foot from their path,

content: 16 For their feet to evil do run, And they haste to shed blood.
content_old: 16 For their feet to evil do run, And they haste to shed blood.

content: 17 Surely in vain is the net spread out before the eyes of any bird.
content_old: 17 Surely in vain is the net spread out before the eyes of any bird.

content: 18 And they for their own blood lay wait, They watch secretly for their own lives.
content_old: 18 And they for their own blood lay wait, They watch secretly for their own lives.

content: 19 So are the paths of every gainer of dishonest gain, The life of its owners it taketh.
content_old: 19 So are the paths of every gainer of dishonest gain, The life of its owners it taketh.

content: 20 Wisdom in an out-place crieth aloud, In broad places she giveth forth her voice,
content_old: 20 Wisdom in an out-place crieth aloud, In broad places she giveth forth her voice,

content: 21 At the head of the multitudes she calleth, In the openings of the gates, In the city her sayings she saith:
content_old: 21 At the head of the multitudes she calleth, In the openings of the gates, In the city her sayings she saith:

content: 22 ‘Till when, ye simple, do ye love simplicity? And have scorners their scorning desired? And do fools hate knowledge?
content_old: 22 ‘Till when, ye simple, do ye love simplicity? And have scorners their scorning desired? And do fools hate knowledge?

content: 23 Turn back at my reproof, lo, I pour forth to you my spirit, I make known my words with you.
content_old: 23 Turn back at my reproof, lo, I pour forth to you my spirit, I make known my words with you.

content: 24 Because I have called, and ye refuse, I stretched out my hand, and none is attending,
content_old: 24 Because I have called, and ye refuse, I stretched out my hand, and none is attending,

content: 25 And ye slight all my counsel, And my reproof ye have not desired.
content_old: 25 And ye slight all my counsel, And my reproof ye have not desired.

content: 26 I also in your calamity do laugh, I deride when your fear cometh,
content_old: 26 I also in your calamity do laugh, I deride when your fear cometh,

content: 27 When your fear cometh as destruction, And your calamity as a hurricane doth come, When on you come adversity and distress.
content_old: 27 When your fear cometh as destruction, And your calamity as a hurricane doth come, When on you come adversity and distress.

content: 28 Then they call me, and I do not answer, They seek me earnestly, and find me not.
content_old: 28 Then they call me, and I do not answer, They seek me earnestly, and find me not.

content: 29 Because that they have hated knowledge, And the fear of Jehovah have not chosen.
content_old: 29 Because that they have hated knowledge, And the fear of Jehovah have not chosen.

content: 30 They have not consented to my counsel, They have despised all my reproof,
content_old: 30 They have not consented to my counsel, They have despised all my reproof,

content: 31 And they eat of the fruit of their way, And from their own counsels they are filled.
content_old: 31 And they eat of the fruit of their way, And from their own counsels they are filled.

content: 32 For the turning of the simple slayeth them, And the security of the foolish destroyeth them.
content_old: 32 For the turning of the simple slayeth them, And the security of the foolish destroyeth them.

content: 1 My son, if thou dost accept my sayings, And my commands dost lay up with thee,
content_old: 1 My son, if thou dost accept my sayings, And my commands dost lay up with thee,

content: 2 To cause thine ear to attend to wisdom, Thou inclinest thy heart to understanding,
content_old: 2 To cause thine ear to attend to wisdom, Thou inclinest thy heart to understanding,

content: 3 For, if for intelligence thou callest, For understanding givest forth thy voice,
content_old: 3 For, if for intelligence thou callest, For understanding givest forth thy voice,

content: 4 If thou dost seek her as silver, And as hid treasures searchest for her,
content_old: 4 If thou dost seek her as silver, And as hid treasures searchest for her,

content: 5 Then understandest thou fear of Jehovah, And knowledge of God thou findest.
content_old: 5 Then understandest thou fear of Jehovah, And knowledge of God thou findest.

content: 6 For Jehovah giveth wisdom, From His mouth knowledge and understanding.
content_old: 6 For Jehovah giveth wisdom, From His mouth knowledge and understanding.

content: 7 Even to lay up for the upright substance, A shield for those walking uprightly.
content_old: 7 Even to lay up for the upright substance, A shield for those walking uprightly.

content: 8 To keep the paths of judgment, And the way of His saints He preserveth.
content_old: 8 To keep the paths of judgment, And the way of His saints He preserveth.

content: 9 Then understandest thou righteousness, And judgment, and uprightness—every good path.
content_old: 9 Then understandest thou righteousness, And judgment, and uprightness—every good path.

content: 10 For wisdom cometh into thy heart, And knowledge to thy soul is pleasant,
content_old: 10 For wisdom cometh into thy heart, And knowledge to thy soul is pleasant,

content: 11 Thoughtfulness doth watch over thee, Understanding doth keep thee,
content_old: 11 Thoughtfulness doth watch over thee, Understanding doth keep thee,

content: 12 To deliver thee from an evil way, From any speaking froward things,
content_old: 12 To deliver thee from an evil way, From any speaking froward things,

content: 13 Who are forsaking paths of uprightness, To walk in ways of darkness,
content_old: 13 Who are forsaking paths of uprightness, To walk in ways of darkness,

content: 14 Who are rejoicing to do evil, They delight in frowardness of the wicked,
content_old: 14 Who are rejoicing to do evil, They delight in frowardness of the wicked,

content: 15 Whose paths are crooked, Yea, they are perverted in their ways.
content_old: 15 Whose paths are crooked, Yea, they are perverted in their ways.

content: 16 To deliver thee from the strange woman, From the stranger who hath made smooth her sayings,
content_old: 16 To deliver thee from the strange woman, From the stranger who hath made smooth her sayings,

content: 17 Who is forsaking the guide of her youth, And the covenant of her God hath forgotten.
content_old: 17 Who is forsaking the guide of her youth, And the covenant of her God hath forgotten.

content: 18 For her house hath inclined unto death, And unto Rephaim her paths.
content_old: 18 For her house hath inclined unto death, And unto Rephaim her paths.

content: 19 None going in unto her turn back, Nor do they reach the paths of life.
content_old: 19 None going in unto her turn back, Nor do they reach the paths of life.

content: 20 That thou dost go in the way of the good, And the paths of the righteous dost keep.
content_old: 20 That thou dost go in the way of the good, And the paths of the righteous dost keep.

content: 21 For the upright do inhabit the earth, And the perfect are left in it,
content_old: 21 For the upright do inhabit the earth, And the perfect are left in it,

content: 1 My son! my law forget not, And my commands let thy heart keep,
content_old: 1 My son! my law forget not, And my commands let thy heart keep,

content: 2 For length of days and years, Life and peace they do add to thee.
content_old: 2 For length of days and years, Life and peace they do add to thee.

content: 3 Let not kindness and truth forsake thee, Bind them on thy neck, Write them on the tablet of thy heart,
content_old: 3 Let not kindness and truth forsake thee, Bind them on thy neck, Write them on the tablet of thy heart,

content: 4 And find grace and good understanding In the eyes of God and man.
content_old: 4 And find grace and good understanding In the eyes of God and man.

content: 5 Trust unto Jehovah with all thy heart, And unto thine own understanding lean not.
content_old: 5 Trust unto Jehovah with all thy heart, And unto thine own understanding lean not.

content: 6 In all thy ways know thou Him, And He doth make straight thy paths.
content_old: 6 In all thy ways know thou Him, And He doth make straight thy paths.

content: 7 Be not wise in thine own eyes, Fear Jehovah, and turn aside from evil.
content_old: 7 Be not wise in thine own eyes, Fear Jehovah, and turn aside from evil.

content: 8 Healing it is to thy navel, And moistening to thy bones.
content_old: 8 Healing it is to thy navel, And moistening to thy bones.

content: 9 Honour Jehovah from thy substance, And from the beginning of all thine increase;
content_old: 9 Honour Jehovah from thy substance, And from the beginning of all thine increase;

content: 10 And filled are thy barns with plenty, And with new wine thy presses break forth.
content_old: 10 And filled are thy barns with plenty, And with new wine thy presses break forth.

content: 11 Chastisement of Jehovah, my son, despise not, And be not vexed with His reproof,
content_old: 11 Chastisement of Jehovah, my son, despise not, And be not vexed with His reproof,

content: 12 For whom Jehovah loveth He reproveth, Even as a father the son He is pleased with.
content_old: 12 For whom Jehovah loveth He reproveth, Even as a father the son He is pleased with.

content: 13 O the happiness of a man who hath found wisdom, And of a man who bringeth forth understanding.
content_old: 13 O the happiness of a man who hath found wisdom, And of a man who bringeth forth understanding.

content: 14 For better is her merchandise Than the merchandise of silver, And than gold—her increase.
content_old: 14 For better is her merchandise Than the merchandise of silver, And than gold—her increase.

content: 15 Precious she is above rubies, And all thy pleasures are not comparable to her.
content_old: 15 Precious she is above rubies, And all thy pleasures are not comparable to her.

content: 16 Length of days is in her right hand, In her left are wealth and honour.
content_old: 16 Length of days is in her right hand, In her left are wealth and honour.

content: 17 Her ways are ways of pleasantness, And all her paths are peace.
content_old: 17 Her ways are ways of pleasantness, And all her paths are peace.

content: 18 A tree of life she is to those laying hold on her, And whoso is retaining her is happy.
content_old: 18 A tree of life she is to those laying hold on her, And whoso is retaining her is happy.

content: 19 Jehovah by wisdom did found the earth, He prepared the heavens by understanding.
content_old: 19 Jehovah by wisdom did found the earth, He prepared the heavens by understanding.

content: 20 By His knowledge depths have been rent, And clouds do drop dew.
content_old: 20 By His knowledge depths have been rent, And clouds do drop dew.

content: 21 My son! let them not turn from thine eyes, Keep thou wisdom and thoughtfulness,
content_old: 21 My son! let them not turn from thine eyes, Keep thou wisdom and thoughtfulness,

content: 22 And they are life to thy soul, and grace to thy neck.
content_old: 22 And they are life to thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

content: 23 Then thou goest thy way confidently, And thy foot doth not stumble.
content_old: 23 Then thou goest thy way confidently, And thy foot doth not stumble.

content: 24 If thou liest down, thou art not afraid, Yea, thou hast lain down, And sweet hath been thy sleep.
content_old: 24 If thou liest down, thou art not afraid, Yea, thou hast lain down, And sweet hath been thy sleep.

content: 25 Be not afraid of sudden fear, And of the desolation of the wicked when it cometh.
content_old: 25 Be not afraid of sudden fear, And of the desolation of the wicked when it cometh.

content: 26 For Jehovah is at thy side, And He hath kept thy foot from capture.
content_old: 26 For Jehovah is at thy side, And He hath kept thy foot from capture.

content: 27 Withhold not good from its owners, When thy hand is toward God to do it.
content_old: 27 Withhold not good from its owners, When thy hand is toward God to do it.

content: 28 Say not thou to thy friend, ‘Go, and return, and to-morrow I give,’ And substance with thee.
content_old: 28 Say not thou to thy friend, ‘Go, and return, and to-morrow I give,’ And substance with thee.

content: 29 Devise not against thy neighbour evil, And he sitting confidently with thee.
content_old: 29 Devise not against thy neighbour evil, And he sitting confidently with thee.

content: 30 Strive not with a man without cause, If he have not done thee evil.
content_old: 30 Strive not with a man without cause, If he have not done thee evil.

content: 31 Be not envious of a man of violence, Nor fix thou on any of his ways.
content_old: 31 Be not envious of a man of violence, Nor fix thou on any of his ways.

content: 32 For an abomination to Jehovah is the perverted, And with the upright is His secret counsel.
content_old: 32 For an abomination to Jehovah is the perverted, And with the upright is His secret counsel.

content: 33 The curse of Jehovah is in the house of the wicked. And the habitation of the righteous He blesseth.
content_old: 33 The curse of Jehovah is in the house of the wicked. And the habitation of the righteous He blesseth.

content: 34 If the scorners He doth scorn, Yet to the humble He doth give grace.
content_old: 34 If the scorners He doth scorn, Yet to the humble He doth give grace.

content: 1 Hear, ye sons, the instruction of a father, And give attention to know understanding.
content_old: 1 Hear, ye sons, the instruction of a father, And give attention to know understanding.

content: 2 For good learning I have given to you, My law forsake not.
content_old: 2 For good learning I have given to you, My law forsake not.

content: 3 For, a son I have been to my father—tender, And an only one before my mother.
content_old: 3 For, a son I have been to my father—tender, And an only one before my mother.

content: 4 And he directeth me, and he saith to me: ‘Let thy heart retain my words, Keep my commands, and live.
content_old: 4 And he directeth me, and he saith to me: ‘Let thy heart retain my words, Keep my commands, and live.

content: 5 Get wisdom, get understanding, Do not forget, nor turn away From the sayings of my mouth.
content_old: 5 Get wisdom, get understanding, Do not forget, nor turn away From the sayings of my mouth.

content: 6 Forsake her not, and she doth preserve thee, Love her, and she doth keep thee.
content_old: 6 Forsake her not, and she doth preserve thee, Love her, and she doth keep thee.

content: 7 The first thing is wisdom—get wisdom, And with all thy getting get understanding.
content_old: 7 The first thing is wisdom—get wisdom, And with all thy getting get understanding.

content: 8 Exalt her, and she doth lift thee up, She honoureth thee, when thou dost embrace her.
content_old: 8 Exalt her, and she doth lift thee up, She honoureth thee, when thou dost embrace her.

content: 9 She giveth to thy head a wreath of grace, A crown of beauty she doth give thee freely.
content_old: 9 She giveth to thy head a wreath of grace, A crown of beauty she doth give thee freely.

content: 10 Hear, my son, and receive my sayings, And years of life are multiplied to thee.
content_old: 10 Hear, my son, and receive my sayings, And years of life are multiplied to thee.

content: 11 In a way of wisdom I have directed thee, I have caused thee to tread in paths of uprightness.
content_old: 11 In a way of wisdom I have directed thee, I have caused thee to tread in paths of uprightness.

content: 12 In thy walking thy step is not straitened, And if thou runnest, thou stumblest not.
content_old: 12 In thy walking thy step is not straitened, And if thou runnest, thou stumblest not.

content: 13 Lay hold on instruction, do not desist, Keep her, for she is thy life.
content_old: 13 Lay hold on instruction, do not desist, Keep her, for she is thy life.

content: 14 Into the path of the wicked enter not, And be not happy in a way of evil doers.
content_old: 14 Into the path of the wicked enter not, And be not happy in a way of evil doers.

content: 15 Avoid it, pass not over into it, Turn aside from it, and pass on.
content_old: 15 Avoid it, pass not over into it, Turn aside from it, and pass on.

content: 16 For they sleep not if they do not evil, And their sleep hath been taken violently away, If they cause not some to stumble.
content_old: 16 For they sleep not if they do not evil, And their sleep hath been taken violently away, If they cause not some to stumble.

content: 17 For they have eaten bread of wickedness, And wine of violence they drink.
content_old: 17 For they have eaten bread of wickedness, And wine of violence they drink.

content: 18 And the path of the righteous is as a shining light, Going and brightening till the day is established,
content_old: 18 And the path of the righteous is as a shining light, Going and brightening till the day is established,

content: 19 The way of the wicked is as darkness, They have not known at what they stumble.
content_old: 19 The way of the wicked is as darkness, They have not known at what they stumble.

content: 20 My son, to my words give attention, To my sayings incline thine ear,
content_old: 20 My son, to my words give attention, To my sayings incline thine ear,

content: 21 Let them not turn aside from thine eyes, Preserve them in the midst of thy heart.
content_old: 21 Let them not turn aside from thine eyes, Preserve them in the midst of thy heart.

content: 22 For life they are to those finding them, And to all their flesh healing.
content_old: 22 For life they are to those finding them, And to all their flesh healing.

content: 23 Above every charge keep thy heart, For out of it are the outgoings of life.
content_old: 23 Above every charge keep thy heart, For out of it are the outgoings of life.

content: 24 Turn aside from thee a froward mouth, And perverse lips put far from thee,
content_old: 24 Turn aside from thee a froward mouth, And perverse lips put far from thee,

content: 25 Thine eyes do look straightforward, And thine eyelids look straight before thee.
content_old: 25 Thine eyes do look straightforward, And thine eyelids look straight before thee.

content: 26 Ponder thou the path of thy feet, And all thy ways are established.
content_old: 26 Ponder thou the path of thy feet, And all thy ways are established.

content: 1 My son! to my wisdom give attention, To mine understanding incline thine ear,
content_old: 1 My son! to my wisdom give attention, To mine understanding incline thine ear,

content: 2 To observe thoughtfulness, And knowledge do thy lips keep.
content_old: 2 To observe thoughtfulness, And knowledge do thy lips keep.

content: 3 For the lips of a strange woman drop honey, And smoother than oil is her mouth,
content_old: 3 For the lips of a strange woman drop honey, And smoother than oil is her mouth,

content: 4 And her latter end is bitter as wormwood, Sharp as a sword with mouths.
content_old: 4 And her latter end is bitter as wormwood, Sharp as a sword with mouths.

content: 5 Her feet are going down to death, Sheol do her steps take hold of.
content_old: 5 Her feet are going down to death, Sheol do her steps take hold of.

content: 6 The path of life—lest thou ponder, Moved have her paths—thou knowest not.
content_old: 6 The path of life—lest thou ponder, Moved have her paths—thou knowest not.

content: 7 And now, ye sons, hearken to me, And turn not from sayings of my mouth.
content_old: 7 And now, ye sons, hearken to me, And turn not from sayings of my mouth.

content: 8 Keep far from off her thy way, And come not near unto the opening of her house,
content_old: 8 Keep far from off her thy way, And come not near unto the opening of her house,

content: 9 Lest thou give to others thy honour, And thy years to the fierce,
content_old: 9 Lest thou give to others thy honour, And thy years to the fierce,

content: 10 Lest strangers be filled with thy power, And thy labours in the house of a stranger,
content_old: 10 Lest strangers be filled with thy power, And thy labours in the house of a stranger,

content: 11 And thou hast howled in thy latter end, In the consumption of thy flesh and thy food,
content_old: 11 And thou hast howled in thy latter end, In the consumption of thy flesh and thy food,

content: 12 And hast said, ‘How have I hated instruction, And reproof hath my heart despised,
content_old: 12 And hast said, ‘How have I hated instruction, And reproof hath my heart despised,

content: 13 And I have not hearkened to the voice of my directors, And to my teachers have not inclined mine ear.
content_old: 13 And I have not hearkened to the voice of my directors, And to my teachers have not inclined mine ear.

content: 14 As a little thing I have been all evil, In the midst of an assembly and a company.
content_old: 14 As a little thing I have been all evil, In the midst of an assembly and a company.

content: 15 Drink waters out of thine own cistern, Even flowing ones out of thine own well.
content_old: 15 Drink waters out of thine own cistern, Even flowing ones out of thine own well.

content: 16 Let thy fountains be scattered abroad, In broad places rivulets of waters.
content_old: 16 Let thy fountains be scattered abroad, In broad places rivulets of waters.

content: 17 Let them be to thee for thyself, And not to strangers with thee.
content_old: 17 Let them be to thee for thyself, And not to strangers with thee.

content: 18 Let thy fountain be blessed, And rejoice because of the wife of thy youth,
content_old: 18 Let thy fountain be blessed, And rejoice because of the wife of thy youth,

content: 19 A hind of loves, and a roe of grace! Let her loves satisfy thee at all times, In her love magnify thyself continually.
content_old: 19 A hind of loves, and a roe of grace! Let her loves satisfy thee at all times, In her love magnify thyself continually.

content: 20 And why dost thou magnify thyself, My son, with a stranger? And embrace the bosom of a strange woman?
content_old: 20 And why dost thou magnify thyself, My son, with a stranger? And embrace the bosom of a strange woman?

content: 21 For over-against the eyes of Jehovah are the ways of each, And all his paths He is pondering.
content_old: 21 For over-against the eyes of Jehovah are the ways of each, And all his paths He is pondering.

content: 22 His own iniquities do capture the wicked, And with the ropes of his sin he is holden.
content_old: 22 His own iniquities do capture the wicked, And with the ropes of his sin he is holden.

content: 1 My son! if thou hast been surety for thy friend, Hast stricken for a stranger thy hand,
content_old: 1 My son! if thou hast been surety for thy friend, Hast stricken for a stranger thy hand,

content: 2 Hast been snared with sayings of thy mouth, Hast been captured with sayings of thy mouth,
content_old: 2 Hast been snared with sayings of thy mouth, Hast been captured with sayings of thy mouth,

content: 3 Do this now, my son, and be delivered, For thou hast come into the hand of thy friend. Go, trample on thyself, and strengthen thy friend,
content_old: 3 Do this now, my son, and be delivered, For thou hast come into the hand of thy friend. Go, trample on thyself, and strengthen thy friend,

content: 4 Give not sleep to thine eyes, And slumber to thine eyelids,
content_old: 4 Give not sleep to thine eyes, And slumber to thine eyelids,

content: 5 Be delivered as a roe from the hand, And as a bird from the hand of a fowler.
content_old: 5 Be delivered as a roe from the hand, And as a bird from the hand of a fowler.

content: 6 Go unto the ant, O slothful one, See her ways and be wise;
content_old: 6 Go unto the ant, O slothful one, See her ways and be wise;

content: 7 Which hath not captain, overseer, and ruler,
content_old: 7 Which hath not captain, overseer, and ruler,

content: 8 She doth prepare in summer her bread, She hath gathered in harvest her food.
content_old: 8 She doth prepare in summer her bread, She hath gathered in harvest her food.

content: 9 Till when, O slothful one, dost thou lie? When dost thou arise from thy sleep?
content_old: 9 Till when, O slothful one, dost thou lie? When dost thou arise from thy sleep?

content: 10 A little sleep, a little slumber, A little clasping of the hands to rest,
content_old: 10 A little sleep, a little slumber, A little clasping of the hands to rest,

content: 11 And thy poverty hath come as a traveller, And thy want as an armed man.
content_old: 11 And thy poverty hath come as a traveller, And thy want as an armed man.

content: 12 A man of worthlessness, a man of iniquity, Walking with perverseness of mouth,
content_old: 12 A man of worthlessness, a man of iniquity, Walking with perverseness of mouth,

content: 13 Winking with his eyes, speaking with his feet, Directing with his fingers,
content_old: 13 Winking with his eyes, speaking with his feet, Directing with his fingers,

content: 14 Frowardness is in his heart, devising evil at all times, Contentions he sendeth forth.
content_old: 14 Frowardness is in his heart, devising evil at all times, Contentions he sendeth forth.

content: 15 Therefore suddenly cometh his calamity, Instantly he is broken—and no healing.
content_old: 15 Therefore suddenly cometh his calamity, Instantly he is broken—and no healing.

content: 16 These six hath Jehovah hated, Yea, seven are abominations to His soul.
content_old: 16 These six hath Jehovah hated, Yea, seven are abominations to His soul.

content: 17 Eyes high—tongues false—And hands shedding innocent blood—
content_old: 17 Eyes high—tongues false—And hands shedding innocent blood—

content: 18 A heart devising thoughts of vanity—Feet hasting to run to evil—
content_old: 18 A heart devising thoughts of vanity—Feet hasting to run to evil—

content: 19 A false witness who doth breathe out lies—And one sending forth contentions between brethren.
content_old: 19 A false witness who doth breathe out lies—And one sending forth contentions between brethren.

content: 20 Keep, my son, the command of thy father, And leave not the law of thy mother.
content_old: 20 Keep, my son, the command of thy father, And leave not the law of thy mother.

content: 21 Bind them on thy heart continually, Tie them on thy neck.
content_old: 21 Bind them on thy heart continually, Tie them on thy neck.

content: 22 In thy going up and down, it leadeth thee, In thy lying down, it watcheth over thee, And thou hast awaked—it talketh with thee.
content_old: 22 In thy going up and down, it leadeth thee, In thy lying down, it watcheth over thee, And thou hast awaked—it talketh with thee.

content: 23 For a lamp is the command, And the law a light, And a way of life are reproofs of instruction,
content_old: 23 For a lamp is the command, And the law a light, And a way of life are reproofs of instruction,

content: 24 To preserve thee from an evil woman, From the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
content_old: 24 To preserve thee from an evil woman, From the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.

content: 25 Desire not her beauty in thy heart, And let her not take thee with her eyelids.
content_old: 25 Desire not her beauty in thy heart, And let her not take thee with her eyelids.

content: 26 For a harlot consumeth unto a cake of bread, And an adulteress the precious soul hunteth.
content_old: 26 For a harlot consumeth unto a cake of bread, And an adulteress the precious soul hunteth.

content: 27 Doth a man take fire into his bosom, And are his garments not burnt?
content_old: 27 Doth a man take fire into his bosom, And are his garments not burnt?

content: 28 Doth a man walk on the hot coals, And are his feet not scorched?
content_old: 28 Doth a man walk on the hot coals, And are his feet not scorched?

content: 29 So is he who hath gone in unto the wife of his neighbour, None who doth touch her is innocent.
content_old: 29 So is he who hath gone in unto the wife of his neighbour, None who doth touch her is innocent.

content: 30 They do not despise the thief, When he stealeth to fill his soul when he is hungry,
content_old: 30 They do not despise the thief, When he stealeth to fill his soul when he is hungry,

content: 31 And being found he repayeth sevenfold, All the substance of his house he giveth.
content_old: 31 And being found he repayeth sevenfold, All the substance of his house he giveth.

content: 32 He who committeth adultery with a woman lacketh heart, He is destroying his soul who doth it.

content: 33 A stroke and shame he doth find, And his reproach is not wiped away,
content_old: 33 A stroke and shame he doth find, And his reproach is not wiped away,

content: 34 For jealousy is the fury of a man, And he doth not spare in a day of vengeance.

content: 1 My son! keep my sayings, And my commands lay up with thee.
content_old: 1 My son! keep my sayings, And my commands lay up with thee.

content: 2 Keep my commands, and live, And my law as the pupil of thine eye.
content_old: 2 Keep my commands, and live, And my law as the pupil of thine eye.

content: 3 Bind them on thy fingers, Write them on the tablet of thy heart.
content_old: 3 Bind them on thy fingers, Write them on the tablet of thy heart.

content: 4 Say to wisdom, ‘My sister Thou art.’ And cry to understanding, ‘Kinswoman!’
content_old: 4 Say to wisdom, ‘My sister Thou art.’ And cry to understanding, ‘Kinswoman!’

content: 5 To preserve thee from a strange woman, From a stranger who hath made smooth her sayings.
content_old: 5 To preserve thee from a strange woman, From a stranger who hath made smooth her sayings.

content: 6 For, at a window of my house, Through my casement I have looked out,
content_old: 6 For, at a window of my house, Through my casement I have looked out,

content: 7 And I do see among the simple ones, I discern among the sons, A young man lacking understanding,
content_old: 7 And I do see among the simple ones, I discern among the sons, A young man lacking understanding,

content: 8 Passing on in the street, near her corner, And the way to her house he doth step,
content_old: 8 Passing on in the street, near her corner, And the way to her house he doth step,

content: 9 In the twilight—in the evening of day, In the darkness of night and blackness.
content_old: 9 In the twilight—in the evening of day, In the darkness of night and blackness.

content: 10 And, lo, a woman to meet him—(A harlot’s dress, and watchful of heart,
content_old: 10 And, lo, a woman to meet him—(A harlot’s dress, and watchful of heart,

content: 11 Noisy she is, and stubborn, In her house her feet rest not.
content_old: 11 Noisy she is, and stubborn, In her house her feet rest not.

content: 12 Now in an out-place, now in broad places, And near every corner she lieth in wait)—
content_old: 12 Now in an out-place, now in broad places, And near every corner she lieth in wait)—

content_old: 13 And she laid hold on him, and kissed him, She hath hardened her face, and saith to him,

content: 14 ‘Sacrifices of peace-offerings are by me, To-day I have completed my vows.

content: 15 Therefore I have come forth to meet thee, To seek earnestly thy face, and I find thee.
content_old: 15 Therefore I have come forth to meet thee, To seek earnestly thy face, and I find thee.

content: 16 With ornamental coverings I decked my couch, Carved works—cotton of Egypt.
content_old: 16 With ornamental coverings I decked my couch, Carved works—cotton of Egypt.

content: 17 I sprinkled my bed—myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
content_old: 17 I sprinkled my bed—myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

content: 18 Come, we are filled with loves till the morning, We delight ourselves in loves.
content_old: 18 Come, we are filled with loves till the morning, We delight ourselves in loves.

content: 19 For the man is not in his house, He hath gone on a long journey.
content_old: 19 For the man is not in his house, He hath gone on a long journey.

content: 20 A bag of money he hath taken in his hand, At the day of the new moon he cometh to his house.’
content_old: 20 A bag of money he hath taken in his hand, At the day of the new moon he cometh to his house.’

content: 21 She turneth him aside with the abundance of her speech, With the flattery of her lips she forceth him.
content_old: 21 She turneth him aside with the abundance of her speech, With the flattery of her lips she forceth him.

content: 22 He is going after her straightway, As an ox unto the slaughter he cometh, And as a fetter unto the chastisement of a fool,
content_old: 22 He is going after her straightway, As an ox unto the slaughter he cometh, And as a fetter unto the chastisement of a fool,

content: 23 Till an arrow doth split his liver, As a bird hath hastened unto a snare, And hath not known that it is for its life.
content_old: 23 Till an arrow doth split his liver, As a bird hath hastened unto a snare, And hath not known that it is for its life.

content: 24 And now, ye sons, hearken to me, And give attention to sayings of my mouth.
content_old: 24 And now, ye sons, hearken to me, And give attention to sayings of my mouth.

content: 25 Let not thy heart turn unto her ways, Do not wander in her paths,
content_old: 25 Let not thy heart turn unto her ways, Do not wander in her paths,

content: 26 For many are the wounded she caused to fall, And mighty are all her slain ones.
content_old: 26 For many are the wounded she caused to fall, And mighty are all her slain ones.

content: 1 Doth not wisdom call? And understanding give forth her voice?
content_old: 1 Doth not wisdom call? And understanding give forth her voice?

content: 2 At the head of high places by the way, Between the paths she hath stood,
content_old: 2 At the head of high places by the way, Between the paths she hath stood,

content: 3 At the side of the gates, at the mouth of the city, The entrance of the openings, she crieth aloud,
content_old: 3 At the side of the gates, at the mouth of the city, The entrance of the openings, she crieth aloud,

content: 4 ‘Unto you, O men, I call, And my voice is unto the sons of men.
content_old: 4 ‘Unto you, O men, I call, And my voice is unto the sons of men.

content: 5 Understand, ye simple ones, prudence, And ye fools, understand the heart,
content_old: 5 Understand, ye simple ones, prudence, And ye fools, understand the heart,

content: 6 Hearken, for noble things I speak, And the opening of my lips is uprightness.
content_old: 6 Hearken, for noble things I speak, And the opening of my lips is uprightness.

content: 7 For truth doth my mouth utter, And an abomination to my lips is wickedness.
content_old: 7 For truth doth my mouth utter, And an abomination to my lips is wickedness.

content: 8 In righteousness are all the sayings of my mouth, Nothing in them is froward and perverse.
content_old: 8 In righteousness are all the sayings of my mouth, Nothing in them is froward and perverse.

content: 9 All of them are plain to the intelligent, And upright to those finding knowledge.
content_old: 9 All of them are plain to the intelligent, And upright to those finding knowledge.

content: 10 Receive my instruction, and not silver, And knowledge rather than choice gold.
content_old: 10 Receive my instruction, and not silver, And knowledge rather than choice gold.

content: 11 For better is wisdom than rubies, Yea, all delights are not comparable with it.
content_old: 11 For better is wisdom than rubies, Yea, all delights are not comparable with it.

content: 12 I, wisdom, have dwelt with prudence, And a knowledge of devices I find out.
content_old: 12 I, wisdom, have dwelt with prudence, And a knowledge of devices I find out.

content: 13 The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil; Pride, and arrogance, and an evil way, And a froward mouth, I have hated.
content_old: 13 The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil; Pride, and arrogance, and an evil way, And a froward mouth, I have hated.

content: 14 Mine is counsel and substance, I am understanding, I have might.

content: 15 By me kings reign, and princes decree righteousness,
content_old: 15 By me kings reign, and princes decree righteousness,

content: 16 By me do chiefs rule, and nobles, All judges of the earth.
content_old: 16 By me do chiefs rule, and nobles, All judges of the earth.

content: 17 I love those loving me, And those seeking me earnestly do find me.
content_old: 17 I love those loving me, And those seeking me earnestly do find me.

content: 18 Wealth and honour are with me, Lasting substance and righteousness.
content_old: 18 Wealth and honour are with me, Lasting substance and righteousness.

content: 19 Better is my fruit than gold, even fine gold, And mine increase than choice silver.
content_old: 19 Better is my fruit than gold, even fine gold, And mine increase than choice silver.

content: 20 In a path of righteousness I cause to walk, In midst of paths of judgment,
content_old: 20 In a path of righteousness I cause to walk, In midst of paths of judgment,

content: 21 To cause my lovers to inherit substance, Yea, their treasures I fill.
content_old: 21 To cause my lovers to inherit substance, Yea, their treasures I fill.

content: 22 Jehovah possessed me—the beginning of His way, Before His works since then.
content_old: 22 Jehovah possessed me—the beginning of His way, Before His works since then.

content: 23 From the age I was anointed, from the first, From former states of the earth.
content_old: 23 From the age I was anointed, from the first, From former states of the earth.

content: 24 In there being no depths, I was brought forth, In there being no fountains heavy with waters,
content_old: 24 In there being no depths, I was brought forth, In there being no fountains heavy with waters,

content: 25 Before mountains were sunk, Before heights, I was brought forth.
content_old: 25 Before mountains were sunk, Before heights, I was brought forth.

content: 26 While He had not made the earth, and out-places, And the top of the dusts of the world.
content_old: 26 While He had not made the earth, and out-places, And the top of the dusts of the world.

content: 27 In His preparing the heavens I am there, In His decreeing a circle on the face of the deep,
content_old: 27 In His preparing the heavens I am there, In His decreeing a circle on the face of the deep,

content: 28 In His strengthening clouds above, In His making strong fountains of the deep,
content_old: 28 In His strengthening clouds above, In His making strong fountains of the deep,

content: 29 In His setting for the sea its limit, And the waters transgress not His command, In His decreeing the foundations of earth,
content_old: 29 In His setting for the sea its limit, And the waters transgress not His command, In His decreeing the foundations of earth,

content: 30 Then I am near Him, a workman, And I am a delight—day by day. Rejoicing before Him at all times,
content_old: 30 Then I am near Him, a workman, And I am a delight—day by day. Rejoicing before Him at all times,

content: 31 Rejoicing in the habitable part of His earth, And my delights are with the sons of men.
content_old: 31 Rejoicing in the habitable part of His earth, And my delights are with the sons of men.

content: 32 And now, ye sons, hearken to me, Yea, happy are they who keep my ways.
content_old: 32 And now, ye sons, hearken to me, Yea, happy are they who keep my ways.

content: 33 Hear instruction, and be wise, and slight not.
content_old: 33 Hear instruction, and be wise, and slight not.

content: 34 O the happiness of the man hearkening to me, To watch at my doors day by day, To watch at the door-posts of my entrance.
content_old: 34 O the happiness of the man hearkening to me, To watch at my doors day by day, To watch at the door-posts of my entrance.

content: 35 For whoso is finding me, hath found life, And bringeth out good-will from Jehovah.

content: 1 Wisdom hath builded her house, She hath hewn out her pillars—seven.
content_old: 1 Wisdom hath builded her house, She hath hewn out her pillars—seven.

content_old: 2 She hath slaughtered her slaughter, She hath mingled her wine, Yea, she hath arranged her table.

content_old: 3 She hath sent forth her damsels, She crieth on the tops of the high places of the city:

content_old: 4 ‘Who is simple? let him turn aside hither.’ Whoso lacketh heart: she hath said to him,

content: 5 ‘Come, eat of my bread, And drink of the wine I have mingled.
content_old: 5 ‘Come, eat of my bread, And drink of the wine I have mingled.

content: 9 Give to the wise, and he is wiser still, Make known to the righteous, And he increaseth learning.
content_old: 9 Give to the wise, and he is wiser still, Make known to the righteous, And he increaseth learning.

content: 10 The commencement of wisdom is the fear of Jehovah, And a knowledge of the Holy Ones is understanding.
content_old: 10 The commencement of wisdom is the fear of Jehovah, And a knowledge of the Holy Ones is understanding.

content: 11 For by me do thy days multiply, And added to thee are years of life.
content_old: 11 For by me do thy days multiply, And added to thee are years of life.

content: 12 If thou hast been wise, thou hast been wise for thyself, And thou hast scorned—thyself bearest it.
content_old: 12 If thou hast been wise, thou hast been wise for thyself, And thou hast scorned—thyself bearest it.

content: 13 A foolish woman is noisy, Simple, and hath not known what.

content: 15 To call to those passing by the way, Who are going straight on their paths.

content: 1 Proverbs of Solomon. A wise son causeth a father to rejoice, And a foolish son is an affliction to his mother.
content_old: 1 Proverbs of Solomon. A wise son causeth a father to rejoice, And a foolish son is an affliction to his mother.

content: 2 Treasures of wickedness profit not, And righteousness delivereth from death.
content_old: 2 Treasures of wickedness profit not, And righteousness delivereth from death.

content: 3 Jehovah causeth not the soul of the righteous to hunger, And the desire of the wicked He thrusteth away.
content_old: 3 Jehovah causeth not the soul of the righteous to hunger, And the desire of the wicked He thrusteth away.

content: 4 Poor is he who is working—a slothful hand, And the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
content_old: 4 Poor is he who is working—a slothful hand, And the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

content: 5 Whoso is gathering in summer is a wise son, Whoso is sleeping in harvest is a son causing shame.
content_old: 5 Whoso is gathering in summer is a wise son, Whoso is sleeping in harvest is a son causing shame.

content: 6 Blessings are for the head of the righteous, And the mouth of the wicked cover doth violence.
content_old: 6 Blessings are for the head of the righteous, And the mouth of the wicked cover doth violence.

content: 7 The remembrance of the righteous is for a blessing, And the name of the wicked doth rot.
content_old: 7 The remembrance of the righteous is for a blessing, And the name of the wicked doth rot.

content: 8 The wise in heart accepteth commands, And a talkative fool kicketh.
content_old: 8 The wise in heart accepteth commands, And a talkative fool kicketh.

content: 9 Whoso is walking in integrity walketh confidently, And whoso is perverting his ways is known.

content: 10 Whoso is winking the eye giveth grief, And a talkative fool kicketh.
content_old: 10 Whoso is winking the eye giveth grief, And a talkative fool kicketh.

content: 11 A fountain of life is the mouth of the righteous, And the mouth of the wicked cover doth violence.

content: 12 Hatred awaketh contentions, And over all transgressions love covereth.
content_old: 12 Hatred awaketh contentions, And over all transgressions love covereth.

content: 13 In the lips of the intelligent is wisdom found, And a rod is for the back of him who is lacking understanding.
content_old: 13 In the lips of the intelligent is wisdom found, And a rod is for the back of him who is lacking understanding.

content: 14 The wise lay up knowledge, and the mouth of a fool is near ruin.
content_old: 14 The wise lay up knowledge, and the mouth of a fool is near ruin.

content: 15 The wealth of the rich is his strong city, The ruin of the poor is their poverty.
content_old: 15 The wealth of the rich is his strong city, The ruin of the poor is their poverty.

content: 16 The wage of the righteous is for life, The increase of the wicked for sin.
content_old: 16 The wage of the righteous is for life, The increase of the wicked for sin.

content: 17 A traveller to life is he who is keeping instruction, And whoso is forsaking rebuke is erring.
content_old: 17 A traveller to life is he who is keeping instruction, And whoso is forsaking rebuke is erring.

content: 18 Whoso is covering hatred with lying lips, And whoso is bringing out an evil report is a fool.
content_old: 18 Whoso is covering hatred with lying lips, And whoso is bringing out an evil report is a fool.

content: 19 In the abundance of words transgression ceaseth not, And whoso is restraining his lips is wise.
content_old: 19 In the abundance of words transgression ceaseth not, And whoso is restraining his lips is wise.

content: 20 The tongue of the righteous is chosen silver, The heart of the wicked—as a little thing.
content_old: 20 The tongue of the righteous is chosen silver, The heart of the wicked—as a little thing.

content: 21 The lips of the righteous delight many, And fools for lack of heart die.
content_old: 21 The lips of the righteous delight many, And fools for lack of heart die.

content: 22 The blessing of Jehovah—it maketh rich, And He addeth no grief with it.
content_old: 22 The blessing of Jehovah—it maketh rich, And He addeth no grief with it.

content: 23 To execute inventions is as play to a fool, And wisdom to a man of understanding.
content_old: 23 To execute inventions is as play to a fool, And wisdom to a man of understanding.

content: 24 The feared thing of the wicked it meeteth him, And the desire of the righteous is given.
content_old: 24 The feared thing of the wicked it meeteth him, And the desire of the righteous is given.

content: 25 As the passing by of a hurricane, So the wicked is not, And the righteous is a foundation age-during.
content_old: 25 As the passing by of a hurricane, So the wicked is not, And the righteous is a foundation age-during.

content: 26 As vinegar to the teeth, And as smoke to the eyes, So is the slothful to those sending him.
content_old: 26 As vinegar to the teeth, And as smoke to the eyes, So is the slothful to those sending him.

content: 27 The fear of Jehovah addeth days, And the years of the wicked are shortened.
content_old: 27 The fear of Jehovah addeth days, And the years of the wicked are shortened.

content: 28 The hope of the righteous is joyful, And the expectation of the wicked perisheth.
content_old: 28 The hope of the righteous is joyful, And the expectation of the wicked perisheth.

content: 29 The way of Jehovah is strength to the perfect, And ruin to workers of iniquity.
content_old: 29 The way of Jehovah is strength to the perfect, And ruin to workers of iniquity.

content: 30 The righteous to the age is not moved, And the wicked inhabit not the earth.

content: 31 The mouth of the righteous uttereth wisdom, And the tongue of frowardness is cut out.

content: 1 Balances of deceit are an abomination to Jehovah, And a perfect weight is His delight.
content_old: 1 Balances of deceit are an abomination to Jehovah, And a perfect weight is His delight.

content: 2 Pride hath come, and shame cometh, And with the lowly is wisdom.
content_old: 2 Pride hath come, and shame cometh, And with the lowly is wisdom.

content: 3 The integrity of the upright leadeth them, And the perverseness of the treacherous destroyeth them.
content_old: 3 The integrity of the upright leadeth them, And the perverseness of the treacherous destroyeth them.

content: 4 Wealth profiteth not in a day of wrath, And righteousness delivereth from death.
content_old: 4 Wealth profiteth not in a day of wrath, And righteousness delivereth from death.

content: 5 The righteousness of the perfect maketh right his way, And by his wickedness doth the wicked fall.
content_old: 5 The righteousness of the perfect maketh right his way, And by his wickedness doth the wicked fall.

content: 6 The righteousness of the upright delivereth them, And in mischief the treacherous are captured.
content_old: 6 The righteousness of the upright delivereth them, And in mischief the treacherous are captured.

content: 7 In the death of a wicked man, hope perisheth, And the expectation of the iniquitous hath been lost.
content_old: 7 In the death of a wicked man, hope perisheth, And the expectation of the iniquitous hath been lost.

content: 8 The righteous from distress is drawn out, And the wicked goeth in instead of him.

content: 9 With the mouth a hypocrite corrupteth his friend, And by knowledge the righteous are drawn out.

content: 10 In the good of the righteous a city exulteth, And in the destruction of the wicked is singing.
content_old: 10 In the good of the righteous a city exulteth, And in the destruction of the wicked is singing.

content: 11 By the blessing of the upright is a city exalted, And by the mouth of the wicked thrown down.
content_old: 11 By the blessing of the upright is a city exalted, And by the mouth of the wicked thrown down.

content: 12 Whoso is despising his neighbour lacketh heart, And a man of understanding keepeth silence.
content_old: 12 Whoso is despising his neighbour lacketh heart, And a man of understanding keepeth silence.

content: 13 A busybody is revealing secret counsel, And the faithful of spirit is covering the matter.

content: 14 Without counsels do a people fall, And deliverance is in a multitude of counsellors.
content_old: 14 Without counsels do a people fall, And deliverance is in a multitude of counsellors.

content: 15 Evil one suffereth when he hath been surety for a stranger, And whoso is hating suretyship is confident.

content: 16 A gracious woman retaineth honour, And terrible men retain riches.

content: 17 A kind man is rewarding his own soul, And the fierce is troubling his own flesh.
content_old: 17 A kind man is rewarding his own soul, And the fierce is troubling his own flesh.

content: 18 The wicked is getting a lying wage, And whoso is sowing righteousness—a true reward.
content_old: 18 The wicked is getting a lying wage, And whoso is sowing righteousness—a true reward.

content: 19 Rightly is righteousness for life, And whoso is pursuing evil—for his own death.

content: 20 An abomination to Jehovah are the perverse of heart, And the perfect of the way are His delight.

content: 21 Hand to hand, the wicked is not acquitted, And the seed of the righteous hath escaped.
content_old: 21 Hand to hand, the wicked is not acquitted, And the seed of the righteous hath escaped.

content: 22 A ring of gold in the nose of a sow—A fair woman and stubborn of behaviour.

content: 23 The desire of the righteous is only good, The hope of the wicked is transgression.

content: 24 There is who is scattering, and yet is increased, And who is keeping back from uprightness, only to want.
content_old: 24 There is who is scattering, and yet is increased, And who is keeping back from uprightness, only to want.

content: 25 A liberal soul is made fat, And whoso is watering, he also is watered.
content_old: 25 A liberal soul is made fat, And whoso is watering, he also is watered.

content: 26 Whoso is withholding corn, the people execrate him, And a blessing is for the head of him who is selling.

content: 27 Whoso is earnestly seeking good Seeketh a pleasing thing, And whoso is seeking evil—it meeteth him.

content: 28 Whoso is confident in his wealth he falleth, And as a leaf, the righteous flourish.

content: 29 Whoso is troubling his own house inheriteth wind, And a servant is the fool to the wise of heart.

content: 30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, And whoso is taking souls is wise.

content: 1 Whoso is loving instruction, is loving knowledge, And whoso is hating reproof is brutish.

content: 2 The good bringeth forth favour from Jehovah, And the man of wicked devices He condemneth.

content: 3 A man is not established by wickedness, And the root of the righteous is not moved.

content: 4 A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband, And as rottenness in his bones is one causing shame.

content: 5 The thoughts of the righteous are justice, The counsels of the wicked—deceit.

content: 8 A stone of grace is the bribe in the eyes of its possessors, Whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
content_old: 8 A stone of grace is the bribe in the eyes of its possessors, Whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.

content: 9 Whoso is covering transgression is seeking love, And whoso is repeating a matter Is separating a familiar friend.
content_old: 9 Whoso is covering transgression is seeking love, And whoso is repeating a matter Is separating a familiar friend.

content: 10 Rebuke cometh down on the intelligent More than a hundred stripes on a fool.
content_old: 10 Rebuke cometh down on the intelligent More than a hundred stripes on a fool.

content: 11 An evil man seeketh only rebellion, And a fierce messenger is sent against him.
content_old: 11 An evil man seeketh only rebellion, And a fierce messenger is sent against him.

content: 12 The meeting of a bereaved bear by a man, And—not a fool in his folly.
content_old: 12 The meeting of a bereaved bear by a man, And—not a fool in his folly.

content: 13 Whoso is returning evil for good, Evil moveth not from his house.
content_old: 13 Whoso is returning evil for good, Evil moveth not from his house.

content: 14 The beginning of contention is a letting out of waters, And before it is meddled with leave the strife.
content_old: 14 The beginning of contention is a letting out of waters, And before it is meddled with leave the strife.

content: 15 Whoso is justifying the wicked, And condemning the righteous, Even both of these are an abomination to Jehovah.

content: 16 Why is this—a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, And a heart there is none?
content_old: 16 Why is this—a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, And a heart there is none?

content: 17 At all times is the friend loving, And a brother for adversity is born.
content_old: 17 At all times is the friend loving, And a brother for adversity is born.

content: 18 A man lacking heart is striking hands, A surety he becometh before his friend.
content_old: 18 A man lacking heart is striking hands, A surety he becometh before his friend.

content: 19 Whoso is loving transgression is loving debate, Whoso is making high his entrance is seeking destruction.
content_old: 19 Whoso is loving transgression is loving debate, Whoso is making high his entrance is seeking destruction.

content: 20 The perverse of heart findeth not good, And the turned in his tongue falleth into evil.
content_old: 20 The perverse of heart findeth not good, And the turned in his tongue falleth into evil.

content: 21 Whoso is begetting a fool hath affliction for it, Yea, the father of a fool rejoiceth not.
content_old: 21 Whoso is begetting a fool hath affliction for it, Yea, the father of a fool rejoiceth not.

content: 22 A rejoicing heart doth good to the body, And a smitten spirit drieth the bone.
content_old: 22 A rejoicing heart doth good to the body, And a smitten spirit drieth the bone.

content: 23 A bribe from the bosom the wicked taketh, To turn aside the paths of judgment.
content_old: 23 A bribe from the bosom the wicked taketh, To turn aside the paths of judgment.

content: 24 The face of the intelligent is to wisdom, And the eyes of a fool—at the end of the earth.
content_old: 24 The face of the intelligent is to wisdom, And the eyes of a fool—at the end of the earth.

content: 25 A provocation to his father is a foolish son, And bitterness to her that bare him.
content_old: 25 A provocation to his father is a foolish son, And bitterness to her that bare him.

content: 26 Also, to fine the righteous is not good, To smite nobles for uprightness.
content_old: 26 Also, to fine the righteous is not good, To smite nobles for uprightness.

content: 27 One acquainted with knowledge is sparing his words, And the cool of temper is a man of understanding.
content_old: 27 One acquainted with knowledge is sparing his words, And the cool of temper is a man of understanding.

content: 1 For an object of desire he who is separated doth seek, With all wisdom he intermeddleth.
content_old: 1 For an object of desire he who is separated doth seek, With all wisdom he intermeddleth.

content: 2 A fool delighteth not in understanding, But—in uncovering his heart.
content_old: 2 A fool delighteth not in understanding, But—in uncovering his heart.

content: 3 With the coming of the wicked come also hath contempt, And with shame—reproach.
content_old: 3 With the coming of the wicked come also hath contempt, And with shame—reproach.

content: 4 Deep waters are the words of a man’s mouth, The fountain of wisdom is a flowing brook.
content_old: 4 Deep waters are the words of a man’s mouth, The fountain of wisdom is a flowing brook.

content: 5 Acceptance of the face of the wicked is not good, To turn aside the righteous in judgment.
content_old: 5 Acceptance of the face of the wicked is not good, To turn aside the righteous in judgment.

content: 6 The lips of a fool enter into strife, And his mouth for stripes calleth.
content_old: 6 The lips of a fool enter into strife, And his mouth for stripes calleth.

content: 7 The mouth of a fool is ruin to him, And his lips are the snare of his soul.
content_old: 7 The mouth of a fool is ruin to him, And his lips are the snare of his soul.

content: 8 The words of a tale-bearer are as self-inflicted wounds, And they have gone down to the inner parts of the heart.
content_old: 8 The words of a tale-bearer are as self-inflicted wounds, And they have gone down to the inner parts of the heart.

content: 9 He also that is remiss in his work, A brother he is to a destroyer.
content_old: 9 He also that is remiss in his work, A brother he is to a destroyer.

content: 10 A tower of strength is the name of Jehovah, Into it the righteous runneth, and is set on high.
content_old: 10 A tower of strength is the name of Jehovah, Into it the righteous runneth, and is set on high.

content: 11 The wealth of the rich is the city of his strength, And as a wall set on high in his own imagination.
content_old: 11 The wealth of the rich is the city of his strength, And as a wall set on high in his own imagination.

content: 12 Before destruction the heart of man is high, And before honour is humility.
content_old: 12 Before destruction the heart of man is high, And before honour is humility.

content: 13 Whoso is answering a matter before he heareth, Folly it is to him and shame.
content_old: 13 Whoso is answering a matter before he heareth, Folly it is to him and shame.

content: 14 The spirit of a man sustaineth his sickness, And a smitten spirit who doth bear?
content_old: 14 The spirit of a man sustaineth his sickness, And a smitten spirit who doth bear?

content: 15 The heart of the intelligent getteth knowledge, And the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
content_old: 15 The heart of the intelligent getteth knowledge, And the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

content: 16 The gift of a man maketh room for him, And before the great it leadeth him.
content_old: 16 The gift of a man maketh room for him, And before the great it leadeth him.

content: 17 Righteous is the first in his own cause, His neighbour cometh and hath searched him.
content_old: 17 Righteous is the first in his own cause, His neighbour cometh and hath searched him.

content: 18 The lot causeth contentions to cease, And between the mighty it separateth.
content_old: 18 The lot causeth contentions to cease, And between the mighty it separateth.

content: 19 A brother transgressed against is as a strong city, And contentions as the bar of a palace.
content_old: 19 A brother transgressed against is as a strong city, And contentions as the bar of a palace.

content: 20 From the fruit of a man’s mouth is his belly satisfied, From the increase of his lips he is satisfied.
content_old: 20 From the fruit of a man’s mouth is his belly satisfied, From the increase of his lips he is satisfied.

content: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue, And those loving it eat its fruit.
content_old: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue, And those loving it eat its fruit.

content: 22 Whoso hath found a wife hath found good, And bringeth out good-will from Jehovah.
content_old: 22 Whoso hath found a wife hath found good, And bringeth out good-will from Jehovah.

content: 23 With supplications doth the poor speak, And the rich answereth fierce things.
content_old: 23 With supplications doth the poor speak, And the rich answereth fierce things.

content: 1 Better is the poor walking in his integrity, Than the perverse in his lips, who is a fool.
content_old: 1 Better is the poor walking in his integrity, Than the perverse in his lips, who is a fool.

content: 2 Also, without knowledge the soul is not good, And the hasty in feet is sinning.
content_old: 2 Also, without knowledge the soul is not good, And the hasty in feet is sinning.

content: 3 The folly of man perverteth his way, And against Jehovah is his heart wroth.
content_old: 3 The folly of man perverteth his way, And against Jehovah is his heart wroth.

content: 4 Wealth addeth many friends, And the poor from his neighbour is separated.
content_old: 4 Wealth addeth many friends, And the poor from his neighbour is separated.

content: 5 A false witness is not acquitted, Whoso breatheth out lies is not delivered.
content_old: 5 A false witness is not acquitted, Whoso breatheth out lies is not delivered.

content: 6 Many entreat the face of the noble, And all have made friendship to a man of gifts.
content_old: 6 Many entreat the face of the noble, And all have made friendship to a man of gifts.

content: 7 All the brethren of the poor have hated him, Surely also his friends have been far from him, He is pursuing words—they are not!
content_old: 7 All the brethren of the poor have hated him, Surely also his friends have been far from him, He is pursuing words—they are not!

content: 8 Whoso is getting heart is loving his soul, He is keeping understanding to find good.
content_old: 8 Whoso is getting heart is loving his soul, He is keeping understanding to find good.

content: 9 A false witness is not acquitted, And whoso breatheth out lies perisheth.
content_old: 9 A false witness is not acquitted, And whoso breatheth out lies perisheth.

content: 10 Luxury is not comely for a fool, Much less for a servant to rule among princes.
content_old: 10 Luxury is not comely for a fool, Much less for a servant to rule among princes.

content: 11 The wisdom of a man hath deferred his anger, And his glory is to pass over transgression.
content_old: 11 The wisdom of a man hath deferred his anger, And his glory is to pass over transgression.

content: 12 The wrath of a king is a growl as of a young lion, And as dew on the herb his good-will.
content_old: 12 The wrath of a king is a growl as of a young lion, And as dew on the herb his good-will.

content: 13 A calamity to his father is a foolish son, And the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.
content_old: 13 A calamity to his father is a foolish son, And the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

content: 14 House and wealth are the inheritance of fathers, And from Jehovah is an understanding wife.
content_old: 14 House and wealth are the inheritance of fathers, And from Jehovah is an understanding wife.

content: 15 Sloth causeth deep sleep to fall, And an indolent soul doth hunger.
content_old: 15 Sloth causeth deep sleep to fall, And an indolent soul doth hunger.

content: 16 Whoso is keeping the command is keeping his soul, Whoso is despising His ways dieth.
content_old: 16 Whoso is keeping the command is keeping his soul, Whoso is despising His ways dieth.

content: 17 Whoso is lending to Jehovah is favouring the poor, And his deed He repayeth to him.
content_old: 17 Whoso is lending to Jehovah is favouring the poor, And his deed He repayeth to him.

content: 18 Chastise thy son, for there is hope, And to put him to death lift not up thy soul.
content_old: 18 Chastise thy son, for there is hope, And to put him to death lift not up thy soul.

content: 19 A man of great wrath is bearing punishment, For, if thou dost deliver, yet again thou dost add.
content_old: 19 A man of great wrath is bearing punishment, For, if thou dost deliver, yet again thou dost add.

content: 20 Hear counsel and receive instruction, So that thou art wise in thy latter end.
content_old: 20 Hear counsel and receive instruction, So that thou art wise in thy latter end.

content: 21 Many are the purposes in a man’s heart, And the counsel of Jehovah it standeth.
content_old: 21 Many are the purposes in a man’s heart, And the counsel of Jehovah it standeth.

content: 22 The desirableness of a man is his kindness, And better is the poor than a liar.
content_old: 22 The desirableness of a man is his kindness, And better is the poor than a liar.

content: 23 The fear of Jehovah is to life, And satisfied he remaineth—he is not charged with evil.
content_old: 23 The fear of Jehovah is to life, And satisfied he remaineth—he is not charged with evil.

content: 24 The slothful hath hidden his hand in a dish, Even unto his mouth he bringeth it not back.
content_old: 24 The slothful hath hidden his hand in a dish, Even unto his mouth he bringeth it not back.

content: 25 A scorner smite, and the simple acts prudently, And give reproof to the intelligent, He understandeth knowledge.
content_old: 25 A scorner smite, and the simple acts prudently, And give reproof to the intelligent, He understandeth knowledge.

content: 26 Whoso is spoiling a father causeth a mother to flee, A son causing shame, and bringing confusion.
content_old: 26 Whoso is spoiling a father causeth a mother to flee, A son causing shame, and bringing confusion.

content: 27 Cease, my son, to hear instruction—To err from sayings of knowledge.
content_old: 27 Cease, my son, to hear instruction—To err from sayings of knowledge.

content: 28 A worthless witness scorneth judgment, And the mouth of the wicked swalloweth iniquity.
content_old: 28 A worthless witness scorneth judgment, And the mouth of the wicked swalloweth iniquity.

content: 1 Wine is a scorner—strong drink is noisy, And any going astray in it is not wise.
content_old: 1 Wine is a scorner—strong drink is noisy, And any going astray in it is not wise.

content: 2 The fear of a king is a growl as of a young lion, He who is causing him to be wroth is wronging his soul.
content_old: 2 The fear of a king is a growl as of a young lion, He who is causing him to be wroth is wronging his soul.

content: 3 An honour to a man is cessation from strife, And every fool intermeddleth.
content_old: 3 An honour to a man is cessation from strife, And every fool intermeddleth.

content: 4 Because of winter the slothful plougheth not, He asketh in harvest, and there is nothing.
content_old: 4 Because of winter the slothful plougheth not, He asketh in harvest, and there is nothing.

content: 5 Counsel in the heart of a man is deep water, And a man of understanding draweth it up.

content: 6 A multitude of men proclaim each his kindness, And a man of stedfastness who doth find?
content_old: 6 A multitude of men proclaim each his kindness, And a man of stedfastness who doth find?

content: 7 The righteous is walking habitually in his integrity, O the happiness of his sons after him!
content_old: 7 The righteous is walking habitually in his integrity, O the happiness of his sons after him!

content: 8 A king sitting on a throne of judgment, Is scattering with his eyes all evil,

content: 9 Who saith, ‘I have purified my heart, I have been cleansed from my sin?’
content_old: 9 Who saith, ‘I have purified my heart, I have been cleansed from my sin?’

content: 10 A stone and a stone, an ephah and an ephah, Even both of them are an abomination to Jehovah.

content: 11 Even by his actions a youth maketh himself known, Whether his work be pure or upright.

content_old: 12 A hearing ear, and a seeing eye, Jehovah hath made even both of them.

content: 13 Love not sleep, lest thou become poor, Open thine eyes—be satisfied with bread.
content_old: 13 Love not sleep, lest thou become poor, Open thine eyes—be satisfied with bread.

content: 14 ‘Bad, bad,’ saith the buyer, And going his way then he boasteth himself.
content_old: 14 ‘Bad, bad,’ saith the buyer, And going his way then he boasteth himself.

content: 15 Substance, gold, and a multitude of rubies, Yea, a precious vessel, are lips of knowledge.

content: 16 Take his garment when a stranger hath been surety, And for strangers pledge it.
content_old: 16 Take his garment when a stranger hath been surety, And for strangers pledge it.

content: 17 Sweet to a man is the bread of falsehood, And afterwards is his mouth filled with gravel.
content_old: 17 Sweet to a man is the bread of falsehood, And afterwards is his mouth filled with gravel.

content: 18 Purposes by counsel thou dost establish, And with plans make thou war.
content_old: 18 Purposes by counsel thou dost establish, And with plans make thou war.

content: 19 A revealer of secret counsels is the busybody, And for a deceiver with his lips make not thyself surety.

content: 21 An inheritance gotten wrongly at first, Even its latter end is not blessed.

content: 22 Do not say, ‘I recompense evil,�� Wait for Jehovah, and He delivereth thee.
content_old: 22 Do not say, ‘I recompense evil,�� Wait for Jehovah, and He delivereth thee.

content: 23 An abomination to Jehovah are a stone and a stone, And balances of deceit are not good.

content: 24 From Jehovah are the steps of a man, And man—how understandeth he his way?
content_old: 24 From Jehovah are the steps of a man, And man—how understandeth he his way?

content: 25 A snare to a man is he hath swallowed a holy thing, And after vows to make inquiry.

content: 26 A wise king is scattering the wicked, And turneth back on them the wheel.

content_old: 27 The breath of man is a lamp of Jehovah, Searching all the inner parts of the heart.

content: 28 Kindness and truth keep a king, And he hath supported by kindness his throne.
content_old: 28 Kindness and truth keep a king, And he hath supported by kindness his throne.

content: 29 The beauty of young men is their strength, And the honour of old men is grey hairs.
content_old: 29 The beauty of young men is their strength, And the honour of old men is grey hairs.

content: 1 Rivulets of waters is the heart of a king in the hand of Jehovah, Wherever He pleaseth He inclineth it.

content: 2 Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, And Jehovah is pondering hearts.
content_old: 2 Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, And Jehovah is pondering hearts.

content: 3 To do righteousness and judgment, Is chosen of Jehovah rather than sacrifice.

content: 4 Loftiness of eyes, and breadth of heart, Tillage of the wicked is sin.
content_old: 4 Loftiness of eyes, and breadth of heart, Tillage of the wicked is sin.

content: 5 The purposes of the diligent are only to advantage, And of every hasty one, only to want.
content_old: 5 The purposes of the diligent are only to advantage, And of every hasty one, only to want.

content: 6 The making of treasures by a lying tongue, Is a vanity driven away of those seeking death.
