content: 7 The spoil of the wicked catcheth them, Because they have refused to do judgment.
content_old: 7 The spoil of the wicked catcheth them, Because they have refused to do judgment.

content: 8 Froward is the way of a man who is vile, And the pure—upright is his work.
content_old: 8 Froward is the way of a man who is vile, And the pure—upright is his work.

content: 9 Better to sit on a corner of the roof, Than with a woman of contentions and a house of company.
content_old: 9 Better to sit on a corner of the roof, Than with a woman of contentions and a house of company.

content: 10 The soul of the wicked hath desired evil, Not gracious in his eyes is his neighbour.
content_old: 10 The soul of the wicked hath desired evil, Not gracious in his eyes is his neighbour.

content: 11 When the scorner is punished, the simple becometh wise, And in giving understanding to the wise He receiveth knowledge.
content_old: 11 When the scorner is punished, the simple becometh wise, And in giving understanding to the wise He receiveth knowledge.

content: 12 The Righteous One is acting wisely Towards the house of the wicked, He is overthrowing the wicked for wickedness.
content_old: 12 The Righteous One is acting wisely Towards the house of the wicked, He is overthrowing the wicked for wickedness.

content: 13 Whoso is shutting his ear from the cry of the poor, He also doth cry, and is not answered.
content_old: 13 Whoso is shutting his ear from the cry of the poor, He also doth cry, and is not answered.

content: 14 A gift in secret pacifieth anger, And a bribe in the bosom strong fury.
content_old: 14 A gift in secret pacifieth anger, And a bribe in the bosom strong fury.

content: 15 To do justice is joy to the righteous, But ruin to workers of iniquity.
content_old: 15 To do justice is joy to the righteous, But ruin to workers of iniquity.

content: 16 A man who is wandering from the way of understanding, In an assembly of Rephaim resteth.
content_old: 16 A man who is wandering from the way of understanding, In an assembly of Rephaim resteth.

content: 17 Whoso is loving mirth is a poor man, Whoso is loving wine and oil maketh no wealth.
content_old: 17 Whoso is loving mirth is a poor man, Whoso is loving wine and oil maketh no wealth.

content: 18 The wicked is an atonement for the righteous, And for the upright the treacherous dealer.
content_old: 18 The wicked is an atonement for the righteous, And for the upright the treacherous dealer.

content: 19 Better to dwell in a wilderness land, Than with a woman of contentions and anger.
content_old: 19 Better to dwell in a wilderness land, Than with a woman of contentions and anger.

content: 20 A treasure to be desired, and oil, Is in the habitation of the wise, And a foolish man swalloweth it up.
content_old: 20 A treasure to be desired, and oil, Is in the habitation of the wise, And a foolish man swalloweth it up.

content: 21 Whoso is pursuing righteousness and kindness, Findeth life, righteousness, and honour.
content_old: 21 Whoso is pursuing righteousness and kindness, Findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

content: 22 A city of the mighty hath the wise gone up, And bringeth down the strength of its confidence.
content_old: 22 A city of the mighty hath the wise gone up, And bringeth down the strength of its confidence.

content: 23 Whoso is keeping his mouth and his tongue, Is keeping from adversities his soul.
content_old: 23 Whoso is keeping his mouth and his tongue, Is keeping from adversities his soul.

content: 24 Proud, haughty, scorner is his name, Who is working in the wrath of pride.
content_old: 24 Proud, haughty, scorner is his name, Who is working in the wrath of pride.

content: 25 The desire of the slothful slayeth him, For his hands have refused to work.
content_old: 25 The desire of the slothful slayeth him, For his hands have refused to work.

content: 26 All the day desiring he hath desired, And the righteous giveth and withholdeth not.
content_old: 26 All the day desiring he hath desired, And the righteous giveth and withholdeth not.

content: 27 The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination, Much more when in wickedness he bringeth it.
content_old: 27 The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination, Much more when in wickedness he bringeth it.

content: 28 A false witness doth perish, And an attentive man for ever speaketh.
content_old: 28 A false witness doth perish, And an attentive man for ever speaketh.

content: 29 A wicked man hath hardened by his face, And the upright—he prepareth his way.
content_old: 29 A wicked man hath hardened by his face, And the upright—he prepareth his way.

content: 30 There is no wisdom, nor understanding, Nor counsel, over-against Jehovah.
content_old: 30 There is no wisdom, nor understanding, Nor counsel, over-against Jehovah.

content: 1 A name is chosen rather than much wealth, Than silver and than gold—good grace.
content_old: 1 A name is chosen rather than much wealth, Than silver and than gold—good grace.

content: 2 Rich and poor have met together, The Maker of them all is Jehovah.
content_old: 2 Rich and poor have met together, The Maker of them all is Jehovah.

content: 3 The prudent hath seen the evil, and is hidden, And the simple have passed on, and are punished.
content_old: 3 The prudent hath seen the evil, and is hidden, And the simple have passed on, and are punished.

content: 4 The end of humility is the fear of Jehovah, Riches, and honour, and life.
content_old: 4 The end of humility is the fear of Jehovah, Riches, and honour, and life.

content: 5 Thorns—snares are in the way of the perverse, Whoso is keeping his soul is far from them.
content_old: 5 Thorns—snares are in the way of the perverse, Whoso is keeping his soul is far from them.

content: 6 Give instruction to a youth about his way, Even when he is old he turneth not from it.
content_old: 6 Give instruction to a youth about his way, Even when he is old he turneth not from it.

content: 7 The rich over the poor ruleth, And a servant is the borrower to the lender.
content_old: 7 The rich over the poor ruleth, And a servant is the borrower to the lender.

content: 8 Whoso is sowing perverseness reapeth sorrow, And the rod of his anger weareth out.
content_old: 8 Whoso is sowing perverseness reapeth sorrow, And the rod of his anger weareth out.

content: 9 The good of eye—he is blessed, For he hath given of his bread to the poor.
content_old: 9 The good of eye—he is blessed, For he hath given of his bread to the poor.

content: 10 Cast out a scorner—and contention goeth out, And strife and shame cease.
content_old: 10 Cast out a scorner—and contention goeth out, And strife and shame cease.

content: 11 Whoso is loving cleanness of heart, Grace are his lips, a king is his friend.
content_old: 11 Whoso is loving cleanness of heart, Grace are his lips, a king is his friend.

content: 12 The eyes of Jehovah have kept knowledge, And He overthroweth the words of the treacherous.
content_old: 12 The eyes of Jehovah have kept knowledge, And He overthroweth the words of the treacherous.

content: 13 The slothful hath said, ‘A lion is without, In the midst of the broad places I am slain.’
content_old: 13 The slothful hath said, ‘A lion is without, In the midst of the broad places I am slain.’

content: 14 A deep pit is the mouth of strange women, The abhorred of Jehovah falleth there.
content_old: 14 A deep pit is the mouth of strange women, The abhorred of Jehovah falleth there.

content: 15 Folly is bound up in the heart of a youth, The rod of chastisement putteth it far from him.
content_old: 15 Folly is bound up in the heart of a youth, The rod of chastisement putteth it far from him.

content: 16 He is oppressing the poor to multiply to him, He is giving to the rich—only to want.
content_old: 16 He is oppressing the poor to multiply to him, He is giving to the rich—only to want.

content: 17 Incline thine ear, and hear words of the wise, And thy heart set to my knowledge,
content_old: 17 Incline thine ear, and hear words of the wise, And thy heart set to my knowledge,

content: 18 For they are pleasant when thou dost keep them in thy heart, They are prepared together for thy lips.
content_old: 18 For they are pleasant when thou dost keep them in thy heart, They are prepared together for thy lips.

content: 19 That thy trust may be in Jehovah, I caused thee to know to-day, even thou.
content_old: 19 That thy trust may be in Jehovah, I caused thee to know to-day, even thou.

content: 20 Have I not written to thee three times With counsels and knowledge?
content_old: 20 Have I not written to thee three times With counsels and knowledge?

content: 21 To cause thee to know the certainty of sayings of truth, To return sayings of truth to those sending thee.
content_old: 21 To cause thee to know the certainty of sayings of truth, To return sayings of truth to those sending thee.

content: 22 Rob not the poor because he is poor, And bruise not the afflicted in the gate.
content_old: 22 Rob not the poor because he is poor, And bruise not the afflicted in the gate.

content: 23 For Jehovah pleadeth their cause, And hath spoiled the soul of their spoilers.
content_old: 23 For Jehovah pleadeth their cause, And hath spoiled the soul of their spoilers.

content: 24 Shew not thyself friendly with an angry man, And with a man of fury go not in,
content_old: 24 Shew not thyself friendly with an angry man, And with a man of fury go not in,

content: 25 Lest thou learn his paths, And have received a snare to thy soul.
content_old: 25 Lest thou learn his paths, And have received a snare to thy soul.

content: 26 Be not thou among those striking hands, Among sureties for burdens.
content_old: 26 Be not thou among those striking hands, Among sureties for burdens.

content: 27 If thou hast nothing to pay, Why doth he take thy bed from under thee?
content_old: 27 If thou hast nothing to pay, Why doth he take thy bed from under thee?

content: 28 Remove not a border of olden times, That thy fathers have made.
content_old: 28 Remove not a border of olden times, That thy fathers have made.

content: 1 When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, Thou considerest diligently that which is before thee,
content_old: 1 When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, Thou considerest diligently that which is before thee,

content: 2 And thou hast put a knife to thy throat, If thou art a man of appetite.
content_old: 2 And thou hast put a knife to thy throat, If thou art a man of appetite.

content: 3 Have no desire to his dainties, seeing it is lying food.
content_old: 3 Have no desire to his dainties, seeing it is lying food.

content: 4 Labour not to make wealth, From thine own understanding cease, Dost thou cause thine eyes to fly upon it? Then it is not.
content_old: 4 Labour not to make wealth, From thine own understanding cease, Dost thou cause thine eyes to fly upon it? Then it is not.

content: 5 For wealth maketh to itself wings, As an eagle it flieth to the heavens.
content_old: 5 For wealth maketh to itself wings, As an eagle it flieth to the heavens.

content: 6 Eat not the bread of an evil eye, And have no desire to his dainties,
content_old: 6 Eat not the bread of an evil eye, And have no desire to his dainties,

content: 7 For as he hath thought in his soul, so is he, ‘Eat and drink,’ saith he to thee, And his heart is not with thee.
content_old: 7 For as he hath thought in his soul, so is he, ‘Eat and drink,’ saith he to thee, And his heart is not with thee.

content: 8 Thy morsel thou hast eaten thou dost vomit up, And hast marred thy words that are sweet.
content_old: 8 Thy morsel thou hast eaten thou dost vomit up, And hast marred thy words that are sweet.

content: 9 In the ears of a fool speak not, For he treadeth on the wisdom of thy words.
content_old: 9 In the ears of a fool speak not, For he treadeth on the wisdom of thy words.

content: 10 Remove not a border of olden times, And into fields of the fatherless enter not,
content_old: 10 Remove not a border of olden times, And into fields of the fatherless enter not,

content: 11 For their Redeemer is strong, He doth plead their cause with thee.
content_old: 11 For their Redeemer is strong, He doth plead their cause with thee.

content: 12 Bring in to instruction thy heart, And thine ear to sayings of knowledge.
content_old: 12 Bring in to instruction thy heart, And thine ear to sayings of knowledge.

content: 13 Withhold not from a youth chastisement, When thou smitest him with a rod he dieth not.
content_old: 13 Withhold not from a youth chastisement, When thou smitest him with a rod he dieth not.

content: 14 Thou with a rod smitest him, And his soul from Sheol thou deliverest.
content_old: 14 Thou with a rod smitest him, And his soul from Sheol thou deliverest.

content: 15 My son, if thy heart hath been wise, My heart rejoiceth, even mine,
content_old: 15 My son, if thy heart hath been wise, My heart rejoiceth, even mine,

content: 16 And my reins exult when thy lips speak uprightly.
content_old: 16 And my reins exult when thy lips speak uprightly.

content: 17 Let not thy heart be envious at sinners, But—in the fear of Jehovah all the day.
content_old: 17 Let not thy heart be envious at sinners, But—in the fear of Jehovah all the day.

content: 18 For, is there a posterity? Then thy hope is not cut off.
content_old: 18 For, is there a posterity? Then thy hope is not cut off.

content: 19 Hear thou, my son, and be wise, And make happy in the way thy heart,
content_old: 19 Hear thou, my son, and be wise, And make happy in the way thy heart,

content: 20 Be not thou among quaffers of wine, Among gluttonous ones of flesh,
content_old: 20 Be not thou among quaffers of wine, Among gluttonous ones of flesh,

content: 21 For the quaffer and glutton become poor, And drowsiness clotheth with rags.
content_old: 21 For the quaffer and glutton become poor, And drowsiness clotheth with rags.

content: 22 Hearken to thy father, who begat thee, And despise not thy mother when she hath become old.
content_old: 22 Hearken to thy father, who begat thee, And despise not thy mother when she hath become old.

content: 23 Truth buy, and sell not, Wisdom, and instruction, and understanding,
content_old: 23 Truth buy, and sell not, Wisdom, and instruction, and understanding,

content: 24 The father of the righteous rejoiceth greatly, The begetter of the wise rejoiceth in him.
content_old: 24 The father of the righteous rejoiceth greatly, The begetter of the wise rejoiceth in him.

content: 25 Rejoice doth thy father and thy mother, Yea, she that bare thee is joyful.
content_old: 25 Rejoice doth thy father and thy mother, Yea, she that bare thee is joyful.

content: 26 Give, my son, thy heart to me, And let thine eyes watch my ways.
content_old: 26 Give, my son, thy heart to me, And let thine eyes watch my ways.

content: 27 For a harlot is a deep ditch, And a strange woman is a strait pit.
content_old: 27 For a harlot is a deep ditch, And a strange woman is a strait pit.

content: 28 She also, as catching prey, lieth in wait, And the treacherous among men she increaseth.
content_old: 28 She also, as catching prey, lieth in wait, And the treacherous among men she increaseth.

content: 29 Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? Who hath contentions? who hath plaint? Who hath wounds without cause? Who hath redness of eyes?
content_old: 29 Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? Who hath contentions? who hath plaint? Who hath wounds without cause? Who hath redness of eyes?

content: 30 Those tarrying by the wine, Those going in to search out mixed wine.
content_old: 30 Those tarrying by the wine, Those going in to search out mixed wine.

content: 31 See not wine when it showeth itself red, When it giveth in the cup its colour, It goeth up and down through the upright.
content_old: 31 See not wine when it showeth itself red, When it giveth in the cup its colour, It goeth up and down through the upright.

content: 32 Its latter end—as a serpent it biteth, And as a basilisk it stingeth.
content_old: 32 Its latter end—as a serpent it biteth, And as a basilisk it stingeth.

content: 33 Thine eyes see strange women, And thy heart speaketh perverse things.
content_old: 33 Thine eyes see strange women, And thy heart speaketh perverse things.

content: 34 And thou hast been as one lying down in the heart of the sea, And as one lying down on the top of a mast.
content_old: 34 And thou hast been as one lying down in the heart of the sea, And as one lying down on the top of a mast.

content: 1 Be not envious of evil men, And desire not to be with them.
content_old: 1 Be not envious of evil men, And desire not to be with them.

content: 2 For destruction doth their heart meditate, And perverseness do their lips speak.
content_old: 2 For destruction doth their heart meditate, And perverseness do their lips speak.

content: 3 By wisdom is a house builded, And by understanding it establisheth itself.
content_old: 3 By wisdom is a house builded, And by understanding it establisheth itself.

content: 4 And by knowledge the inner parts are filled, With all precious and pleasant wealth.
content_old: 4 And by knowledge the inner parts are filled, With all precious and pleasant wealth.

content: 5 Mighty is the wise in strength, And a man of knowledge is strengthening power,
content_old: 5 Mighty is the wise in strength, And a man of knowledge is strengthening power,

content: 6 For by plans thou makest for thyself war, And deliverance is in a multitude of counsellors.
content_old: 6 For by plans thou makest for thyself war, And deliverance is in a multitude of counsellors.

content: 7 Wisdom is high for a fool, In the gate he openeth not his mouth.
content_old: 7 Wisdom is high for a fool, In the gate he openeth not his mouth.

content: 8 Whoso is devising to do evil, Him they call a master of wicked thoughts.
content_old: 8 Whoso is devising to do evil, Him they call a master of wicked thoughts.

content: 9 The thought of folly is sin, And an abomination to man is a scorner.
content_old: 9 The thought of folly is sin, And an abomination to man is a scorner.

content: 10 Thou hast shewed thyself weak in a day of adversity, Straitened is thy power,
content_old: 10 Thou hast shewed thyself weak in a day of adversity, Straitened is thy power,

content: 11 If from delivering those taken to death, And those slipping to the slaughter—thou keepest back.
content_old: 11 If from delivering those taken to death, And those slipping to the slaughter—thou keepest back.

content: 12 When thou sayest, ‘Lo, we knew not this.’ Is not the Ponderer of hearts He who understandeth? And the Keeper of thy soul He who knoweth? And He hath rendered to man according to his work.
content_old: 12 When thou sayest, ‘Lo, we knew not this.’ Is not the Ponderer of hearts He who understandeth? And the Keeper of thy soul He who knoweth? And He hath rendered to man according to his work.

content: 13 Eat my son, honey that is good, And the honeycomb—sweet to thy palate.
content_old: 13 Eat my son, honey that is good, And the honeycomb—sweet to thy palate.

content: 14 So is the knowledge of wisdom to thy soul, If thou hast found that there is a posterity And thy hope is not cut off.
content_old: 14 So is the knowledge of wisdom to thy soul, If thou hast found that there is a posterity And thy hope is not cut off.

content: 15 Lay not wait, O wicked one, At the habitation of the righteous. Do not spoil his resting-place.
content_old: 15 Lay not wait, O wicked one, At the habitation of the righteous. Do not spoil his resting-place.

content: 16 For seven times doth the righteous fall and rise, And the wicked stumble in evil.
content_old: 16 For seven times doth the righteous fall and rise, And the wicked stumble in evil.

content: 17 In the falling of thine enemy rejoice not, And in his stumbling let not thy heart be joyful,
content_old: 17 In the falling of thine enemy rejoice not, And in his stumbling let not thy heart be joyful,

content: 18 Lest Jehovah see, and it be evil in His eyes, And He hath turned from off him His anger.
content_old: 18 Lest Jehovah see, and it be evil in His eyes, And He hath turned from off him His anger.

content: 19 Fret not thyself at evil doers, Be not envious at the wicked,
content_old: 19 Fret not thyself at evil doers, Be not envious at the wicked,

content: 20 For there is not a posterity to the evil, The lamp of the wicked is extinguished.
content_old: 20 For there is not a posterity to the evil, The lamp of the wicked is extinguished.

content: 21 Fear Jehovah, my son, and the king, With changers mix not up thyself,
content_old: 21 Fear Jehovah, my son, and the king, With changers mix not up thyself,

content: 22 For suddenly doth their calamity rise, And the ruin of them both—who knoweth!
content_old: 22 For suddenly doth their calamity rise, And the ruin of them both—who knoweth!

content: 23 These also are for the wise:—To discern faces in judgment is not good.
content_old: 23 These also are for the wise:—To discern faces in judgment is not good.

content: 24 Whoso is saying to the wicked, ‘Thou art righteous,’ Peoples execrate him—nations abhor him.
content_old: 24 Whoso is saying to the wicked, ‘Thou art righteous,’ Peoples execrate him—nations abhor him.

content: 25 And to those reproving it is pleasant, And on them cometh a good blessing.
content_old: 25 And to those reproving it is pleasant, And on them cometh a good blessing.

content: 26 Lips he kisseth who is returning straightforward words.
content_old: 26 Lips he kisseth who is returning straightforward words.

content: 27 Prepare in an out-place thy work, And make it ready in the field—go afterwards, Then thou hast built thy house.
content_old: 27 Prepare in an out-place thy work, And make it ready in the field—go afterwards, Then thou hast built thy house.

content: 28 Be not a witness for nought against thy neighbour, Or thou hast enticed with thy lips.
content_old: 28 Be not a witness for nought against thy neighbour, Or thou hast enticed with thy lips.

content: 29 Say not, ‘As he did to me, so I do to him, I render to each according to his work.’
content_old: 29 Say not, ‘As he did to me, so I do to him, I render to each according to his work.’

content: 30 Near the field of a slothful man I passed by, And near the vineyard of a man lacking heart.
content_old: 30 Near the field of a slothful man I passed by, And near the vineyard of a man lacking heart.

content: 31 And lo, it hath gone up—all of it—thorns! Covered its face have nettles, And its stone wall hath been broken down.
content_old: 31 And lo, it hath gone up—all of it—thorns! Covered its face have nettles, And its stone wall hath been broken down.

content: 32 And I see—I—I do set my heart, I have seen—I have received instruction,
content_old: 32 And I see—I—I do set my heart, I have seen—I have received instruction,

content: 33 A little sleep—a little slumber—A little folding of the hands to lie down.
content_old: 33 A little sleep—a little slumber—A little folding of the hands to lie down.

content: 1 Also these are Proverbs of Solomon, that men of Hezekiah king of Judah transcribed:—
content_old: 1 Also these are Proverbs of Solomon, that men of Hezekiah king of Judah transcribed:—

content: 2 The honour of God is to hide a thing, And the honour of kings to search out a matter.
content_old: 2 The honour of God is to hide a thing, And the honour of kings to search out a matter.

content: 3 The heavens for height, and the earth for depth, And the heart of kings—are unsearchable.
content_old: 3 The heavens for height, and the earth for depth, And the heart of kings—are unsearchable.

content: 4 Take away dross from silver, And a vessel for the refiner goeth forth,
content_old: 4 Take away dross from silver, And a vessel for the refiner goeth forth,

content: 5 Take away the wicked before a king, And established in righteousness is his throne.
content_old: 5 Take away the wicked before a king, And established in righteousness is his throne.

content: 6 Honour not thyself before a king, And in the place of the great stand not.
content_old: 6 Honour not thyself before a king, And in the place of the great stand not.

content: 7 For better that he hath said to thee, ‘Come thou up hither,’ Than that he humble thee before a noble, Whom thine eyes have seen.
content_old: 7 For better that he hath said to thee, ‘Come thou up hither,’ Than that he humble thee before a noble, Whom thine eyes have seen.

content: 8 Go not forth to strive, haste, turn, What dost thou in its latter end, When thy neighbour causeth thee to blush?
content_old: 8 Go not forth to strive, haste, turn, What dost thou in its latter end, When thy neighbour causeth thee to blush?

content: 9 Thy cause plead with thy neighbour, And the secret counsel of another reveal not,
content_old: 9 Thy cause plead with thy neighbour, And the secret counsel of another reveal not,

content: 10 Lest the hearer put thee to shame, And thine evil report turn not back.
content_old: 10 Lest the hearer put thee to shame, And thine evil report turn not back.

content: 11 Apples of gold in imagery of silver, Is the word spoken at its fit times.
content_old: 11 Apples of gold in imagery of silver, Is the word spoken at its fit times.

content: 12 A ring of gold, and an ornament of pure gold, Is the wise reprover to an attentive ear.
content_old: 12 A ring of gold, and an ornament of pure gold, Is the wise reprover to an attentive ear.

content: 13 As a vessel of snow in a day of harvest, So is a faithful ambassador to those sending him, And the soul of his masters he refresheth.
content_old: 13 As a vessel of snow in a day of harvest, So is a faithful ambassador to those sending him, And the soul of his masters he refresheth.

content: 14 Clouds and wind, and rain there is none, Is a man boasting himself in a false gift.
content_old: 14 Clouds and wind, and rain there is none, Is a man boasting himself in a false gift.

content: 15 By long-suffering is a ruler persuaded, And a soft tongue breaketh a bone.
content_old: 15 By long-suffering is a ruler persuaded, And a soft tongue breaketh a bone.

content: 16 Honey thou hast found—eat thy sufficiency, Lest thou be satiated with it, and hast vomited it.
content_old: 16 Honey thou hast found—eat thy sufficiency, Lest thou be satiated with it, and hast vomited it.

content: 17 Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour’s house, Lest he be satiated with thee, and have hated thee.
content_old: 17 Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour’s house, Lest he be satiated with thee, and have hated thee.

content: 18 A maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow, Is the man testifying against his neighbour a false testimony.
content_old: 18 A maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow, Is the man testifying against his neighbour a false testimony.

content: 19 A bad tooth, and a tottering foot, Is the confidence of the treacherous in a day of adversity.
content_old: 19 A bad tooth, and a tottering foot, Is the confidence of the treacherous in a day of adversity.

content: 20 Whoso is taking away a garment in a cold day, Is as vinegar on nitre, And a singer of songs on a sad heart.
content_old: 20 Whoso is taking away a garment in a cold day, Is as vinegar on nitre, And a singer of songs on a sad heart.

content: 21 If he who is hating thee doth hunger, cause him to eat bread, And if he thirst, cause him to drink water.
content_old: 21 If he who is hating thee doth hunger, cause him to eat bread, And if he thirst, cause him to drink water.

content: 22 For coals thou art putting on his head, And Jehovah giveth recompense to thee.
content_old: 22 For coals thou art putting on his head, And Jehovah giveth recompense to thee.

content: 23 A north wind bringeth forth rain, And a secret tongue—indignant faces.
content_old: 23 A north wind bringeth forth rain, And a secret tongue—indignant faces.

content: 24 Better to sit on a corner of a roof, Than with a woman of contentions, and a house of company.
content_old: 24 Better to sit on a corner of a roof, Than with a woman of contentions, and a house of company.

content: 25 As cold waters for a weary soul, So is a good report from a far country.
content_old: 25 As cold waters for a weary soul, So is a good report from a far country.

content: 26 A spring troubled, and a fountain corrupt, Is the righteous falling before the wicked.
content_old: 26 A spring troubled, and a fountain corrupt, Is the righteous falling before the wicked.

content: 27 The eating of much honey is not good, Nor a searching out of one’s own honour—honour.
content_old: 27 The eating of much honey is not good, Nor a searching out of one’s own honour—honour.

content: 1 As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, So honour is not comely for a fool.
content_old: 1 As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, So honour is not comely for a fool.

content: 2 As a bird by wandering, as a swallow by flying, So reviling without cause doth not come.
content_old: 2 As a bird by wandering, as a swallow by flying, So reviling without cause doth not come.

content: 3 A whip is for a horse, a bridle for an ass, And a rod for the back of fools.
content_old: 3 A whip is for a horse, a bridle for an ass, And a rod for the back of fools.

content: 4 Answer not a fool according to his folly, Lest thou be like to him—even thou.
content_old: 4 Answer not a fool according to his folly, Lest thou be like to him—even thou.

content: 5 Answer a fool according to his folly, Lest he be wise in his own eyes.
content_old: 5 Answer a fool according to his folly, Lest he be wise in his own eyes.

content: 6 He is cutting off feet, he is drinking injury, Who is sending things by the hand of a fool.
content_old: 6 He is cutting off feet, he is drinking injury, Who is sending things by the hand of a fool.

content: 7 Weak have been the two legs of the lame, And a parable in the mouth of fools.
content_old: 7 Weak have been the two legs of the lame, And a parable in the mouth of fools.

content: 8 As one who is binding a stone in a sling, So is he who is giving honour to a fool.
content_old: 8 As one who is binding a stone in a sling, So is he who is giving honour to a fool.

content: 9 A thorn hath gone up into the hand of a drunkard, And a parable in the mouth of fools.
content_old: 9 A thorn hath gone up into the hand of a drunkard, And a parable in the mouth of fools.

content: 10 Great is the Former of all, And He is rewarding a fool, And is rewarding transgressors.
content_old: 10 Great is the Former of all, And He is rewarding a fool, And is rewarding transgressors.

content: 11 As a dog hath returned to its vomit, A fool is repeating his folly.
content_old: 11 As a dog hath returned to its vomit, A fool is repeating his folly.

content: 12 Thou hast seen a man wise in his own eyes, More hope of a fool than of him!
content_old: 12 Thou hast seen a man wise in his own eyes, More hope of a fool than of him!

content: 13 The slothful hath said, ‘A lion is in the way, A lion is in the broad places.’
content_old: 13 The slothful hath said, ‘A lion is in the way, A lion is in the broad places.’

content: 14 The door turneth round on its hinge, And the slothful on his bed.
content_old: 14 The door turneth round on its hinge, And the slothful on his bed.

content: 15 The slothful hath hid his hand in a dish, He is weary of bringing it back to his mouth.
content_old: 15 The slothful hath hid his hand in a dish, He is weary of bringing it back to his mouth.

content: 16 Wiser is the slothful in his own eyes, Than seven men returning a reason.
content_old: 16 Wiser is the slothful in his own eyes, Than seven men returning a reason.

content: 17 Laying hold on the ears of a dog, Is a passer-by making himself wrath for strife not his own.
content_old: 17 Laying hold on the ears of a dog, Is a passer-by making himself wrath for strife not his own.

content: 18 As one pretending to be feeble, Who is casting sparks, arrows, and death,
content_old: 18 As one pretending to be feeble, Who is casting sparks, arrows, and death,

content: 19 So hath a man deceived his neighbour, And hath said, ‘Am not I playing?’
content_old: 19 So hath a man deceived his neighbour, And hath said, ‘Am not I playing?’

content: 20 Without wood is fire going out, And without a tale-bearer, contention ceaseth,
content_old: 20 Without wood is fire going out, And without a tale-bearer, contention ceaseth,

content: 21 Coal to burning coals, and wood to fire, And a man of contentions to kindle strife.
content_old: 21 Coal to burning coals, and wood to fire, And a man of contentions to kindle strife.

content: 22 The words of a tale-bearer are as self-inflicted wounds, And they have gone down to the inner parts of the heart.
content_old: 22 The words of a tale-bearer are as self-inflicted wounds, And they have gone down to the inner parts of the heart.

content: 23 Silver of dross spread over potsherd, Are burning lips and an evil heart.
content_old: 23 Silver of dross spread over potsherd, Are burning lips and an evil heart.

content: 24 By his lips doth a hater dissemble, And in his heart he placeth deceit,
content_old: 24 By his lips doth a hater dissemble, And in his heart he placeth deceit,

content: 25 When his voice is gracious trust not in him, For seven abominations are in his heart.
content_old: 25 When his voice is gracious trust not in him, For seven abominations are in his heart.

content: 26 Hatred is covered by deceit, Revealed is its wickedness in an assembly.
content_old: 26 Hatred is covered by deceit, Revealed is its wickedness in an assembly.

content: 27 Whoso is digging a pit falleth into it, And the roller of a stone, to him it turneth.
content_old: 27 Whoso is digging a pit falleth into it, And the roller of a stone, to him it turneth.

content: 1 Boast not thyself of to-morrow, For thou knowest not what a day bringeth forth.
content_old: 1 Boast not thyself of to-morrow, For thou knowest not what a day bringeth forth.

content: 2 Let another praise thee, and not thine own mouth, A stranger, and not thine own lips.
content_old: 2 Let another praise thee, and not thine own mouth, A stranger, and not thine own lips.

content: 3 A stone is heavy, and the sand is heavy, And the anger of a fool Is heavier than they both.
content_old: 3 A stone is heavy, and the sand is heavy, And the anger of a fool Is heavier than they both.

content: 4 Fury is fierce, and anger is overflowing, And who standeth before jealousy?
content_old: 4 Fury is fierce, and anger is overflowing, And who standeth before jealousy?

content: 5 Better is open reproof than hidden love.
content_old: 5 Better is open reproof than hidden love.

content: 6 Faithful are the wounds of a lover, And abundant the kisses of an enemy.
content_old: 6 Faithful are the wounds of a lover, And abundant the kisses of an enemy.

content: 7 A satiated soul treadeth down a honeycomb, And to a hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
content_old: 7 A satiated soul treadeth down a honeycomb, And to a hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.

content: 8 As a bird wandering from her nest, So is a man wandering from his place.
content_old: 8 As a bird wandering from her nest, So is a man wandering from his place.

content: 9 Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart, And the sweetness of one’s friend—from counsel of the soul.
content_old: 9 Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart, And the sweetness of one’s friend—from counsel of the soul.

content: 10 Thine own friend, and the friend of thy father, forsake not, And the house of thy brother enter not In a day of thy calamity, Better is a near neighbour than a brother afar off.
content_old: 10 Thine own friend, and the friend of thy father, forsake not, And the house of thy brother enter not In a day of thy calamity, Better is a near neighbour than a brother afar off.

content: 11 Be wise, my son, and rejoice my heart. And I return my reproacher a word.
content_old: 11 Be wise, my son, and rejoice my heart. And I return my reproacher a word.

content: 12 The prudent hath seen the evil, he is hidden, The simple have passed on, they are punished.
content_old: 12 The prudent hath seen the evil, he is hidden, The simple have passed on, they are punished.

content: 13 Take his garment, when a stranger hath been surety, And for a strange woman pledge it.
content_old: 13 Take his garment, when a stranger hath been surety, And for a strange woman pledge it.

content: 14 Whoso is saluting his friend with a loud voice, In the morning rising early, A light thing it is reckoned to him.
content_old: 14 Whoso is saluting his friend with a loud voice, In the morning rising early, A light thing it is reckoned to him.

content: 15 A continual dropping in a day of rain, And a woman of contentions are alike,
content_old: 15 A continual dropping in a day of rain, And a woman of contentions are alike,

content: 16 Whoso is hiding her hath hidden the wind, And the ointment of his right hand calleth out.
content_old: 16 Whoso is hiding her hath hidden the wind, And the ointment of his right hand calleth out.

content: 17 Iron by iron is sharpened, And a man sharpens the face of his friend.
content_old: 17 Iron by iron is sharpened, And a man sharpens the face of his friend.

content: 18 The keeper of a fig-tree eateth its fruit, And the preserver of his master is honoured.
content_old: 18 The keeper of a fig-tree eateth its fruit, And the preserver of his master is honoured.

content: 19 As in water the face is to face, So the heart of man to man.
content_old: 19 As in water the face is to face, So the heart of man to man.

content: 20 Sheol and destruction are not satisfied, And the eyes of man are not satisfied.
content_old: 20 Sheol and destruction are not satisfied, And the eyes of man are not satisfied.

content: 21 A refining pot is for silver, and a furnace for gold, And a man according to his praise.
content_old: 21 A refining pot is for silver, and a furnace for gold, And a man according to his praise.

content: 22 If thou dost beat the foolish in a mortar, Among washed things—with a pestle, His folly turneth not aside from off him.
content_old: 22 If thou dost beat the foolish in a mortar, Among washed things—with a pestle, His folly turneth not aside from off him.

content: 23 Know well the face of thy flock, Set thy heart to the droves,
content_old: 23 Know well the face of thy flock, Set thy heart to the droves,

content: 24 For riches are not to the age, Nor a crown to generation and generation.
content_old: 24 For riches are not to the age, Nor a crown to generation and generation.

content: 25 Revealed was the hay, and seen the tender grass, And gathered the herbs of mountains.
content_old: 25 Revealed was the hay, and seen the tender grass, And gathered the herbs of mountains.

content: 26 Lambs are for thy clothing, And the price of the field are he-goats,
content_old: 26 Lambs are for thy clothing, And the price of the field are he-goats,

content: 1 The wicked have fled and there is no pursuer. And the righteous as a young lion is confident.
content_old: 1 The wicked have fled and there is no pursuer. And the righteous as a young lion is confident.

content: 2 By the transgression of a land many are its heads. And by an intelligent man, Who knoweth right—it is prolonged.
content_old: 2 By the transgression of a land many are its heads. And by an intelligent man, Who knoweth right—it is prolonged.

content: 3 A man—poor and oppressing the weak, Is a sweeping rain, and there is no bread.
content_old: 3 A man—poor and oppressing the weak, Is a sweeping rain, and there is no bread.

content: 4 Those forsaking the law praise the wicked, Those keeping the law plead against them.
content_old: 4 Those forsaking the law praise the wicked, Those keeping the law plead against them.

content: 5 Evil men understand not judgment, And those seeking Jehovah understand all.
content_old: 5 Evil men understand not judgment, And those seeking Jehovah understand all.

content: 6 Better is the poor walking in his integrity, Than the perverse of ways who is rich.
content_old: 6 Better is the poor walking in his integrity, Than the perverse of ways who is rich.

content: 7 Whoso is keeping the law is an intelligent son, And a friend of gluttons, Doth cause his father to blush.
content_old: 7 Whoso is keeping the law is an intelligent son, And a friend of gluttons, Doth cause his father to blush.

content: 8 Whoso is multiplying his wealth by biting and usury, For one favouring the poor doth gather it.
content_old: 8 Whoso is multiplying his wealth by biting and usury, For one favouring the poor doth gather it.

content: 9 Whoso is turning his ear from hearing the law, Even his prayer is an abomination.
content_old: 9 Whoso is turning his ear from hearing the law, Even his prayer is an abomination.

content: 10 Whoso is causing the upright to err in an evil way, Into his own pit he doth fall, And the perfect do inherit good.
content_old: 10 Whoso is causing the upright to err in an evil way, Into his own pit he doth fall, And the perfect do inherit good.

content: 11 A rich man is wise in his own eyes, And the intelligent poor searcheth him.
content_old: 11 A rich man is wise in his own eyes, And the intelligent poor searcheth him.

content: 12 In the exulting of the righteous the glory is abundant, And in the rising of the wicked man is apprehensive.
content_old: 12 In the exulting of the righteous the glory is abundant, And in the rising of the wicked man is apprehensive.

content: 13 Whoso is covering his transgressions prospereth not, And he who is confessing and forsaking hath mercy.
content_old: 13 Whoso is covering his transgressions prospereth not, And he who is confessing and forsaking hath mercy.

content: 14 O the happiness of a man fearing continually, And whoso is hardening his heart falleth into evil.
content_old: 14 O the happiness of a man fearing continually, And whoso is hardening his heart falleth into evil.

content: 15 A growling lion, and a ranging bear, Is the wicked ruler over a poor people.
content_old: 15 A growling lion, and a ranging bear, Is the wicked ruler over a poor people.

content: 16 A leader lacking understanding multiplieth oppressions, Whoso is hating dishonest gain prolongeth days.
content_old: 16 A leader lacking understanding multiplieth oppressions, Whoso is hating dishonest gain prolongeth days.

content: 17 A man oppressed with the blood of a soul, Unto the pit fleeth, none taketh hold on him.
content_old: 17 A man oppressed with the blood of a soul, Unto the pit fleeth, none taketh hold on him.

content: 18 Whoso is walking uprightly is saved, And the perverted of ways falleth at once.
content_old: 18 Whoso is walking uprightly is saved, And the perverted of ways falleth at once.

content: 19 Whoso is tilling his ground is satisfied with bread, And whoso is pursuing vanity, Is filled with poverty.
content_old: 19 Whoso is tilling his ground is satisfied with bread, And whoso is pursuing vanity, Is filled with poverty.

content: 20 A stedfast man hath multiplied blessings, And whoso is hasting to be rich is not acquitted.
content_old: 20 A stedfast man hath multiplied blessings, And whoso is hasting to be rich is not acquitted.

content: 21 To discern faces is not good, And for a piece of bread doth a man transgress.
content_old: 21 To discern faces is not good, And for a piece of bread doth a man transgress.

content: 22 Troubled for wealth is the man with an evil eye, And he knoweth not that want doth meet him.
content_old: 22 Troubled for wealth is the man with an evil eye, And he knoweth not that want doth meet him.

content: 23 Whoso is reproving a man afterwards findeth grace, More than a flatterer with the tongue.
content_old: 23 Whoso is reproving a man afterwards findeth grace, More than a flatterer with the tongue.

content: 24 Whoso is robbing his father, or his mother, And is saying, ‘It is not transgression,’ A companion he is to a destroyer.
content_old: 24 Whoso is robbing his father, or his mother, And is saying, ‘It is not transgression,’ A companion he is to a destroyer.

content: 25 Whoso is proud in soul stirreth up contention, And whoso is trusting on Jehovah is made fat.
content_old: 25 Whoso is proud in soul stirreth up contention, And whoso is trusting on Jehovah is made fat.

content: 26 Whoso is trusting in his heart is a fool, And whoso is walking in wisdom is delivered.
content_old: 26 Whoso is trusting in his heart is a fool, And whoso is walking in wisdom is delivered.

content: 27 Whoso is giving to the poor hath no lack, And whoso is hiding his eyes multiplied curses.
content_old: 27 Whoso is giving to the poor hath no lack, And whoso is hiding his eyes multiplied curses.

content: 1 A man often reproved, hardening the neck, Is suddenly broken, and there is no healing.
content_old: 1 A man often reproved, hardening the neck, Is suddenly broken, and there is no healing.

content: 2 In the multiplying of the righteous the people rejoice, And in the ruling of the wicked the people sigh.
content_old: 2 In the multiplying of the righteous the people rejoice, And in the ruling of the wicked the people sigh.

content: 3 A man loving wisdom rejoiceth his father, And a friend of harlots destroyeth wealth.
content_old: 3 A man loving wisdom rejoiceth his father, And a friend of harlots destroyeth wealth.

content: 4 A king by judgment establisheth a land, And one receiving gifts throweth it down.
content_old: 4 A king by judgment establisheth a land, And one receiving gifts throweth it down.

content: 5 A man taking a portion above his neighbour, Spreadeth a net for his own steps.
content_old: 5 A man taking a portion above his neighbour, Spreadeth a net for his own steps.

content: 6 In the transgression of the evil is a snare, And the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
content_old: 6 In the transgression of the evil is a snare, And the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

content: 7 The righteous knoweth the plea of the poor, The wicked understandeth not knowledge.
content_old: 7 The righteous knoweth the plea of the poor, The wicked understandeth not knowledge.

content: 8 Men of scorning ensnare a city, And the wise turn back anger.
content_old: 8 Men of scorning ensnare a city, And the wise turn back anger.

content: 9 A wise man is judged by the foolish man, And he hath been angry, And he hath laughed, and there is no rest.
content_old: 9 A wise man is judged by the foolish man, And he hath been angry, And he hath laughed, and there is no rest.

content: 10 Men of blood hate the perfect, And the upright seek his soul.
content_old: 10 Men of blood hate the perfect, And the upright seek his soul.

content: 11 A fool bringeth out all his mind, And the wise till afterwards restraineth it.
content_old: 11 A fool bringeth out all his mind, And the wise till afterwards restraineth it.

content: 12 A ruler who is attending to lying words, All his ministers are wicked.
content_old: 12 A ruler who is attending to lying words, All his ministers are wicked.

content: 13 The poor and the man of frauds have met together, Jehovah is enlightening the eyes of them both.
content_old: 13 The poor and the man of frauds have met together, Jehovah is enlightening the eyes of them both.

content: 14 A king that is judging truly the poor, His throne for ever is established.
content_old: 14 A king that is judging truly the poor, His throne for ever is established.

content: 15 A rod and reproof give wisdom, And a youth let away is shaming his mother.
content_old: 15 A rod and reproof give wisdom, And a youth let away is shaming his mother.

content: 16 In the multiplying of the wicked transgression multiplieth, And the righteous on their fall do look.
content_old: 16 In the multiplying of the wicked transgression multiplieth, And the righteous on their fall do look.

content: 17 Chastise thy son, and he giveth thee comfort, Yea, he giveth delights to thy soul.
content_old: 17 Chastise thy son, and he giveth thee comfort, Yea, he giveth delights to thy soul.

content: 18 Without a Vision is a people made naked, And whoso is keeping the law, O his happiness!
content_old: 18 Without a Vision is a people made naked, And whoso is keeping the law, O his happiness!

content: 19 By words a servant is not instructed though he understand, And there is nothing answering.
content_old: 19 By words a servant is not instructed though he understand, And there is nothing answering.

content: 20 Thou hast seen a man hasty in his words! More hope of a fool than of him.
content_old: 20 Thou hast seen a man hasty in his words! More hope of a fool than of him.

content: 21 Whoso is bringing up his servant delicately, from youth, At his latter end also he is continuator.
content_old: 21 Whoso is bringing up his servant delicately, from youth, At his latter end also he is continuator.

content: 22 An angry man stirreth up contention, And a furious man is multiplying transgression.
content_old: 22 An angry man stirreth up contention, And a furious man is multiplying transgression.

content: 23 The pride of man humbleth him, And humility of spirit upholdeth honour.
content_old: 23 The pride of man humbleth him, And humility of spirit upholdeth honour.

content: 24 Whoso is sharing with a thief is hating his own soul, Execration he heareth, and telleth not.
content_old: 24 Whoso is sharing with a thief is hating his own soul, Execration he heareth, and telleth not.

content: 25 Fear of man causeth a snare, And the confident in Jehovah is set on high.
content_old: 25 Fear of man causeth a snare, And the confident in Jehovah is set on high.

content: 26 Many are seeking the face of a ruler, And from Jehovah is the judgment of each.
content_old: 26 Many are seeking the face of a ruler, And from Jehovah is the judgment of each.

content: 1 Words of a Gatherer, son of an obedient one, the declaration, an affirmation of the man:—I have wearied myself for God, I have wearied myself for God, and am consumed.
content_old: 1 Words of a Gatherer, son of an obedient one, the declaration, an affirmation of the man:—I have wearied myself for God, I have wearied myself for God, and am consumed.

content: 2 For I am more brutish than any one, And have not the understanding of a man.
content_old: 2 For I am more brutish than any one, And have not the understanding of a man.

content: 3 Nor have I learned wisdom, Yet the knowledge of Holy Ones I know.
content_old: 3 Nor have I learned wisdom, Yet the knowledge of Holy Ones I know.

content: 4 Who went up to heaven, and cometh down? Who hath gathered the wind in his fists? Who hath bound waters in a garment? Who established all ends of the earth? What is His name? and what His son’s name? Surely thou knowest!
content_old: 4 Who went up to heaven, and cometh down? Who hath gathered the wind in his fists? Who hath bound waters in a garment? Who established all ends of the earth? What is His name? and what His son’s name? Surely thou knowest!

content: 5 Every saying of God is tried, A shield He is to those trusting in Him.
content_old: 5 Every saying of God is tried, A shield He is to those trusting in Him.

content: 6 Add not to His words, lest He reason with thee, And thou hast been found false.
content_old: 6 Add not to His words, lest He reason with thee, And thou hast been found false.

content: 7 Two things I have asked from Thee, Withhold not from me before I die.
content_old: 7 Two things I have asked from Thee, Withhold not from me before I die.

content: 8 Vanity and a lying word put far from me, Poverty or wealth give not to me, Cause me to eat the bread of my portion,
content_old: 8 Vanity and a lying word put far from me, Poverty or wealth give not to me, Cause me to eat the bread of my portion,

content: 9 Lest I become satiated, and have denied, And have said, ‘Who is Jehovah?’ And lest I be poor, and have stolen, And have laid hold of the name of my God.
content_old: 9 Lest I become satiated, and have denied, And have said, ‘Who is Jehovah?’ And lest I be poor, and have stolen, And have laid hold of the name of my God.

content: 10 Accuse not a servant unto his lord, Lest he disesteem thee, and thou be found guilty.
content_old: 10 Accuse not a servant unto his lord, Lest he disesteem thee, and thou be found guilty.

content: 11 A generation is, that lightly esteemeth their father, And their mother doth not bless.
content_old: 11 A generation is, that lightly esteemeth their father, And their mother doth not bless.

content: 12 A generation—pure in their own eyes, But from their own filth not washed.
content_old: 12 A generation—pure in their own eyes, But from their own filth not washed.

content: 13 A generation—how high are their eyes, Yea, their eyelids are lifted up.
content_old: 13 A generation—how high are their eyes, Yea, their eyelids are lifted up.

content: 14 A generation—swords are their teeth, And knives—their jaw-teeth, To consume the poor from earth, And the needy from among men.
content_old: 14 A generation—swords are their teeth, And knives—their jaw-teeth, To consume the poor from earth, And the needy from among men.

content: 15 To the leech are two daughters, ‘Give, give, Lo, three things are not satisfied, Four have not said ‘Sufficiency;’
content_old: 15 To the leech are two daughters, ‘Give, give, Lo, three things are not satisfied, Four have not said ‘Sufficiency;’

content: 16 Sheol, and a restrained womb, Earth—it is not satisfied with water, And fire—it hath not said, ‘Sufficiency,’
content_old: 16 Sheol, and a restrained womb, Earth—it is not satisfied with water, And fire—it hath not said, ‘Sufficiency,’

content: 17 An eye that mocketh at a father, And despiseth to obey a mother, Dig it out do ravens of the valley, And eat it do young eagles.
content_old: 17 An eye that mocketh at a father, And despiseth to obey a mother, Dig it out do ravens of the valley, And eat it do young eagles.

content: 18 Three things have been too wonderful for me, Yea, four that I have not known:
content_old: 18 Three things have been too wonderful for me, Yea, four that I have not known:

content: 19 The way of the eagle in the heavens, The way of a serpent on a rock, The way of a ship in the heart of the sea, And the way of a man in youth.
content_old: 19 The way of the eagle in the heavens, The way of a serpent on a rock, The way of a ship in the heart of the sea, And the way of a man in youth.

content: 20 So—the way of an adulterous woman, She hath eaten and hath wiped her mouth, And hath said, ‘I have not done iniquity.’
content_old: 20 So—the way of an adulterous woman, She hath eaten and hath wiped her mouth, And hath said, ‘I have not done iniquity.’

content: 21 For three things hath earth been troubled, And for four—it is not able to bear:
content_old: 21 For three things hath earth been troubled, And for four—it is not able to bear:

content: 22 For a servant when he reigneth, And a fool when he is satisfied with bread,
content_old: 22 For a servant when he reigneth, And a fool when he is satisfied with bread,

content: 23 For a hated one when she ruleth, And a maid-servant when she succeedeth her mistress.
content_old: 23 For a hated one when she ruleth, And a maid-servant when she succeedeth her mistress.

content: 24 Four are little ones of earth, And they are made wiser than the wise:
content_old: 24 Four are little ones of earth, And they are made wiser than the wise:

content: 25 The ants are a people not strong, And they prepare in summer their food,
content_old: 25 The ants are a people not strong, And they prepare in summer their food,

content: 26 Conies are a people not strong, And they place in a rock their house,
content_old: 26 Conies are a people not strong, And they place in a rock their house,

content: 27 A king there is not to the locust, And it goeth out—each one shouting,
content_old: 27 A king there is not to the locust, And it goeth out—each one shouting,

content: 28 A spider with two hands taketh hold, And is in the palaces of a king.
content_old: 28 A spider with two hands taketh hold, And is in the palaces of a king.

content: 29 Three there are going well, Yea, four are good in going:
content_old: 29 Three there are going well, Yea, four are good in going:

content: 30 An old lion—mighty among beasts, That turneth not back from the face of any,
content_old: 30 An old lion—mighty among beasts, That turneth not back from the face of any,

content: 31 A girt one of the loins, or a he-goat, And a king—no rising up with him.
content_old: 31 A girt one of the loins, or a he-goat, And a king—no rising up with him.

content: 32 If thou hast been foolish in lifting up thyself, And if thou hast devised evil—hand to mouth!
content_old: 32 If thou hast been foolish in lifting up thyself, And if thou hast devised evil—hand to mouth!

content: 1 Words of Lemuel a king, a declaration that his mother taught him:
content_old: 1 Words of Lemuel a king, a declaration that his mother taught him:

content: 2 ‘What, my son? and what, son of my womb? And what, son of my vows?
content_old: 2 ‘What, my son? and what, son of my womb? And what, son of my vows?

content: 3 Give not to women thy strength, And thy ways to wiping away of kings.
content_old: 3 Give not to women thy strength, And thy ways to wiping away of kings.

content: 4 Not for kings, O Lemuel, Not for kings, to drink wine, And for princes a desire of strong drink.
content_old: 4 Not for kings, O Lemuel, Not for kings, to drink wine, And for princes a desire of strong drink.

content: 5 Lest he drink, and forget the decree, And change the judgment of any of the sons of affliction.
content_old: 5 Lest he drink, and forget the decree, And change the judgment of any of the sons of affliction.

content: 6 Give strong drink to the perishing, And wine to the bitter in soul,
content_old: 6 Give strong drink to the perishing, And wine to the bitter in soul,

content: 7 He drinketh, and forgetteth his poverty, And his misery he remembereth not again.
content_old: 7 He drinketh, and forgetteth his poverty, And his misery he remembereth not again.

content: 8 Open thy mouth for the dumb, For the right of all sons of change.
content_old: 8 Open thy mouth for the dumb, For the right of all sons of change.

content: 9 Open thy mouth, judge righteously, Both the cause of the poor and needy!’
content_old: 9 Open thy mouth, judge righteously, Both the cause of the poor and needy!’

content: 10 A woman of worth who doth find? Yea, far above rubies is her price.
content_old: 10 A woman of worth who doth find? Yea, far above rubies is her price.

content: 11 The heart of her husband hath trusted in her, And spoil he lacketh not.
content_old: 11 The heart of her husband hath trusted in her, And spoil he lacketh not.

content: 12 She hath done him good, and not evil, All days of her life.
content_old: 12 She hath done him good, and not evil, All days of her life.

content: 13 She hath sought wool and flax, And with delight she worketh with her hands.
content_old: 13 She hath sought wool and flax, And with delight she worketh with her hands.

content: 14 She hath been as ships of the merchant, From afar she bringeth in her bread.
content_old: 14 She hath been as ships of the merchant, From afar she bringeth in her bread.

content: 15 Yea, she riseth while yet night, And giveth food to her household, And a portion to her damsels.
content_old: 15 Yea, she riseth while yet night, And giveth food to her household, And a portion to her damsels.

content: 16 She hath considered a field, and taketh it, From the fruit of her hands she hath planted a vineyard.
content_old: 16 She hath considered a field, and taketh it, From the fruit of her hands she hath planted a vineyard.

content: 17 She hath girded with might her loins, And doth strengthen her arms.
content_old: 17 She hath girded with might her loins, And doth strengthen her arms.

content: 18 She hath perceived when her merchandise is good, Her lamp is not extinguished in the night.
content_old: 18 She hath perceived when her merchandise is good, Her lamp is not extinguished in the night.

content: 19 Her hands she hath sent forth on a spindle, And her hands have held a distaff.
content_old: 19 Her hands she hath sent forth on a spindle, And her hands have held a distaff.

content: 20 Her hand she hath spread forth to the poor, Yea, her hands she sent forth to the needy.
content_old: 20 Her hand she hath spread forth to the poor, Yea, her hands she sent forth to the needy.

content: 21 She is not afraid of her household from snow, For all her household are clothed with scarlet.
content_old: 21 She is not afraid of her household from snow, For all her household are clothed with scarlet.

content: 22 Ornamental coverings she hath made for herself, Silk and purple are her clothing.
content_old: 22 Ornamental coverings she hath made for herself, Silk and purple are her clothing.

content: 23 Known in the gates is her husband, In his sitting with elders of the land.
content_old: 23 Known in the gates is her husband, In his sitting with elders of the land.

content: 24 Linen garments she hath made, and selleth, And a girdle she hath given to the merchant.
content_old: 24 Linen garments she hath made, and selleth, And a girdle she hath given to the merchant.

content: 25 Strength and honour are her clothing, And she rejoiceth at a latter day.
content_old: 25 Strength and honour are her clothing, And she rejoiceth at a latter day.

content: 26 Her mouth she hath opened in wisdom, And the law of kindness is on her tongue.
content_old: 26 Her mouth she hath opened in wisdom, And the law of kindness is on her tongue.

content: 27 She is watching the ways of her household, And bread of sloth she eateth not.
content_old: 27 She is watching the ways of her household, And bread of sloth she eateth not.

content: 28 Her sons have risen up, and pronounce her happy, Her husband, and he praiseth her,
content_old: 28 Her sons have risen up, and pronounce her happy, Her husband, and he praiseth her,

content: 29 ‘Many are the daughters who have done worthily, Thou hast gone up above them all.’
content_old: 29 ‘Many are the daughters who have done worthily, Thou hast gone up above them all.’

content: 30 The grace is false, and the beauty is vain, A woman fearing Jehovah, she may boast herself.
content_old: 30 The grace is false, and the beauty is vain, A woman fearing Jehovah, she may boast herself.
